title = Ri¢hie Ri¢h 
overview = Billionaire heir Richie Rich has it all, including Reggie Jackson as a batting coach and Claudia Schiffer as a personal trainer -- but no playmates. What's more, scoundrel Laurence Van Dough is scheming to take over the family empire. Uh-oh! Enter faithful butler Cadbury to save the day. 
production compagnie = Davis Entertainment 
cast = Macaulay Culkin, John Larroquette, Edward Herrmann, Christine Ebersole 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Davis Entertainment 

In "Ri¢hie Ri¢h," billionaire heir Richie Rich seemingly has everything a kid could dream of, from famous coaches to celebrity trainers. However, one thing he lacks is friends to share his lavish lifestyle with. As he navigates the challenges of being the wealthiest child in the world, Richie must also outsmart the conniving Laurence Van Dough, who has his eyes set on taking over the family empire. Luckily, the loyal butler Cadbury steps in to help thwart Van Dough's plans and save the day. Starring Macaulay Culkin as Richie Rich, alongside John Larroquette, Edward Herrmann, and Christine Ebersole, this Davis Entertainment production is a delightful blend of adventure, humor, and heartwarming moments.

The production company behind "Ri¢hie Ri¢h" is Davis Entertainment.

title = Ball of Fire 
overview = A group of academics have spent years shut up in a house working on the definitive encyclopedia. When one of them discovers that his entry on slang is hopelessly outdated, he ventures into the wide world to learn about the evolving language. Here he meets Sugarpuss O'Shea, a nightclub singer, who's on top of all the slang and, it just so happens, needs a place to stay. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the captivating film "Ball of Fire," a dedicated group of academics immerses themselves in compiling the ultimate encyclopedia within the confines of their home. However, their scholarly pursuits take an unexpected turn when one member realizes his section on slang is antiquated. Determined to modernize his knowledge, he ventures into the outside world where he encounters Sugarpuss O'Shea, a savvy nightclub singer well-versed in contemporary language. As their worlds collide, a unique bond forms between the academic and the entertainer, leading to a delightful exploration of evolving slang and unexpected connections. Set against a backdrop of witty dialogue and endearing characters, "Ball of Fire" is a charming tale that showcases the power of language and human connection. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Career Opportunities 
overview = Josie, the daughter of the town's wealthiest businessman, faces problems at home and wishes to leave town but is disoriented. Her decision is finalized after she falls asleep in a Target dressing room. She awakens to find herself locked in the store overnight with the janitor, Jim, the town "no hoper" and liar. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 155.3 millions of dollars 

In the movie "Career Opportunities," Josie, the daughter of the town's wealthiest businessman, finds herself at a crossroads in life. Feeling trapped and disoriented, she longs to escape her troubles at home. Her chance for a new beginning comes unexpectedly when she falls asleep in a Target dressing room and wakes up to a surprising twist of fate. Locked in the store overnight with Jim, the town's notorious "no hoper" and compulsive liar, Josie embarks on a journey of self-discovery and unexpected companionship. As the night unfolds, secrets are revealed, and unlikely bonds are formed, leading Josie to realize that sometimes, the most unexpected opportunities can lead to the most fulfilling careers.

Feeling trapped and disoriented, she longs to escape her troubles at home. Her chance for a new beginning comes unexpectedly when she falls asleep in a Target dressing room and wakes up to a surprising twist of fate. Locked in the store overnight with Jim, the town's notorious "no hoper" and compulsive liar, Josie embarks on a journey of self-discovery and unexpected companionship. As the night unfolds, secrets are revealed, and unlikely bonds are formed, leading Josie to realize that sometimes, the most unexpected opportunities can lead to the most fulfilling careers.

title = Cocktail 
overview = Gautam is an incorrigible flirt, who runs after every girl he sees. Meera is a pretty girl with desi values and attire, who comes to London from Delhi for a fresh start. Veronica is the spoilt bombshell who loves partying and drinking. Though different from each other, these three are perfect friends staying under one roof until friendship becomes confusing, and love becomes complicated. 
Director = Homi Adajania 
duration of the movie = 2h24 
tagline = Sometimes good friends may be too good to share... 
production countrie = India 
production compagnie = Eros International 
average note = 6.2 
Producer = Saif Ali Khan 
revenue = 18.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 13 of July 2012 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
cast = Deepika Padukone, Saif Ali Khan, Randeep Hooda, Diana Penty 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Homi Adajania 

In the 2012 Hindi film "Cocktail," directed by Homi Adajania and produced by Saif Ali Khan, we are introduced to three contrasting characters - Gautam, a charming flirt, Meera, a traditional girl from Delhi seeking a fresh start in London, and Veronica, a carefree party lover. Despite their differences, the trio forms an unlikely friendship while living together under one roof. As their bond deepens, feelings of love and confusion begin to emerge, leading to unexpected twists and turns. With a runtime of 2 hours and 24 minutes, this Eros International production takes viewers on a journey of friendship, love, and self-discovery. Starring Deepika Padukone, Saif Ali Khan, Randeep Hooda, and Diana Penty, "Cocktail" explores the complexities of relationships and the blurred lines between friendship and romance. Released on July 13, 2012, in India, this movie received an average rating of 6.2 and grossed $18.8 million at the box office. With the tagline "Sometimes good friends may be too good to share," "Cocktail" is a captivating tale of friendship and love set against the vibrant backdrop of London.

title = Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer 
overview = Henry likes to kill people, in different ways each time. Henry shares an apartment with Otis. When Otis' sister comes to stay, we see both sides of Henry: "the guy next door" and the serial killer. 
Producer = Steven A. Jones 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
cast = Michael Rooker, Tracy Arnold, Tom Towles, David Katz 
revenue = 17.5 millions of dollars 
Director = John McNaughton 
tagline = The shocking true story of Henry Lee Lucas. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Steven A. Jones 

In "Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer," directed by John McNaughton and produced by Steven A. Jones, we are introduced to Henry, a chilling character who has a disturbing hobby - he likes to kill people in various ways. Living with his roommate Otis, the film delves into the dual nature of Henry as both "the guy next door" and a ruthless serial killer. When Otis' sister moves in, the tension escalates, revealing the dark depths of Henry's psyche. Starring Michael Rooker, Tracy Arnold, Tom Towles, and David Katz, this gripping thriller runs for 1 hour and 23 minutes. With a revenue of 17.5 million dollars, "Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer" unveils the shocking true story of Henry Lee Lucas, leaving audiences on the edge of their seats.

title = 10 Rules for Sleeping Around 
overview = By following ten simple rules,  20-somethings Vince and Cameron spice up their relationship by sleeping around. But when their straitlaced friends get engaged, their relationship gets turned upside down. To put the rules to the test, they will go on the road to the Hamptons to crash the biggest party of the year where love triangles collide and off-the-wall mayhem ensues. 
Producer = Herb Nanas 
cast = Jesse Bradford, Tammin Sursok, Chris Marquette, Virginia Williams 
average note = 3.9 
Director = Leslie Greif 
budget = 94.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = Now it's our turn. 
production compagnie = Thinkfactory Media 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Herb Nanas 

In "10 Rules for Sleeping Around," produced by Herb Nanas and directed by Leslie Greif, 20-somethings Vince and Cameron decide to spice up their relationship by following ten simple rules that involve sleeping around. However, their plans take a turn when their more traditional friends announce their engagement, causing chaos in their own relationship. To test the rules, they embark on a journey to crash a lavish party in the Hamptons, where love triangles and wild antics abound. Starring Jesse Bradford, Tammin Sursok, Chris Marquette, and Virginia Williams, this comedy explores the consequences of breaking the rules in the name of excitement. With a budget of 94.2 million dollars and an average rating of 3.9, "10 Rules for Sleeping Around" promises a wild ride where the tagline "Now it's our turn" sets the tone for the off-the-wall mayhem that unfolds. The production company behind the film is Thinkfactory Media.

['correct']
fact : tagline = Now it's our turn. 

In "10 Rules for Sleeping Around," produced by Herb Nanas and directed by Leslie Greif, 20-somethings Vince and Cameron decide to spice up their relationship by following ten simple rules that involve sleeping around. However, their plans take a turn when their more traditional friends announce their engagement, causing chaos in their own relationship. To test the rules, they embark on a journey to crash a lavish party in the Hamptons, where love triangles and wild antics abound. Starring Jesse Bradford, Tammin Sursok, Chris Marquette, and Virginia Williams, this comedy explores the consequences of breaking the rules in the name of excitement. With a budget of 94.2 million dollars and an average rating of 3.9, "10 Rules for Sleeping Around" promises a wild ride where the tagline "Now it's our turn" sets the tone for the off-the-wall mayhem that unfolds. The production company behind the film is Thinkfactory Media.

title = The Other Woman 
overview = After discovering her boyfriend is married, Carly soon meets the wife he's been cheating on. And when yet another affair is discovered, all three women team up to plot mutual revenge on the three-timing SOB. 
tagline = The oddest friends are about to get even 
date of release = the 16 of April 2014 
average note = 6.2 
duration of the movie = 1h49 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The oddest friends are about to get even 

In "The Other Woman," released on the 16th of April 2014, Carly's world is turned upside down when she learns that her boyfriend is married. As she navigates the shock of this revelation, she unexpectedly forms a bond with the wife her boyfriend has been cheating on. When they uncover yet another affair, the three women join forces to seek revenge on the three-timing SOB. With a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, this comedy showcases the power of female solidarity in the face of betrayal. As the tagline suggests, "The oddest friends are about to get even." With an average rating of 6.2, this film delivers a mix of humor, heart, and a satisfying dose of comeuppance.

title = Cuba 
overview = A British mercenary arrives in pre-Revolution Cuba to help train the corrupt General Batista's army against Castro's guerrillas while he also romances a former lover now married to an unscrupulous plantation owner. 
Director = Richard Lester 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Richard Lester 

title = Cuba 
overview = A British mercenary arrives in pre-Revolution Cuba to help train the corrupt General Batista's army against Castro's guerrillas while he also romances a former lover now married to an unscrupulous plantation owner. 
Director = Richard Lester 

In the movie "Cuba," directed by Richard Lester, a British mercenary finds himself in pre-Revolution Cuba, where he is tasked with training General Batista's corrupt army to combat Castro's guerrillas. Amidst the political turmoil, he rekindles a passionate romance with a woman who is now married to a deceitful plantation owner. As the tension escalates between the opposing forces, the mercenary must navigate love, loyalty, and betrayal in a country on the brink of revolution.

overview = A British mercenary arrives in pre-Revolution Cuba to help train the corrupt General Batista's army against Castro's guerrillas while he also romances a former lover now married to an unscrupulous plantation owner. 
Director = Richard Lester 

In the movie "Cuba," directed by Richard Lester, a British mercenary finds himself in pre-Revolution Cuba, where he is tasked with training General Batista's corrupt army to combat Castro's guerrillas. Amidst the political turmoil, he rekindles a passionate romance with a woman who is now married to a deceitful plantation owner. As the tension escalates between the opposing forces, the mercenary must navigate love, loyalty, and betrayal in a country on the brink of revolution. 
 
 

 
title = Godzilla vs. Mothra 
overview = The Earth is headed for disaster and when an archeological research team visits Infant Island to find out why, they discover two tiny women who reveal that the Earth is fighting back for all the harm humans have done here and sends out the evil Battra to destroy us. The Cosmos, as the girls are called, offer their help by calling Mothra to battle the creature. Unfortunately, Godzilla also appears and a three way battle begins that threatens to destroy Japan. 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
budget = 259.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.1 
production compagnie = Toho Pictures, Inc. 
Director = Takao Okawara 
tagline = Great battle of vibrant colors! 
date of release = the 12 of December 1992 
production countrie = Japan 
Producer = Shogo Tomiyama 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
cast = Tetsuya Bessho, Satomi Kobayashi, Takehiro Murata, Saburo Shinoda 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = Japanese 

In the epic Japanese film "Godzilla vs. Mothra," directed by Takao Okawara and produced by Shogo Tomiyama, the Earth faces imminent disaster as ancient forces awaken. When an archeological team uncovers the truth on Infant Island, they encounter the mystical Cosmos, who reveal that the planet is retaliating against humanity's destruction. The evil Battra is unleashed to wreak havoc, prompting the Cosmos to summon the mighty Mothra for a colossal showdown. However, chaos ensues when the legendary Godzilla emerges, setting the stage for a three-way battle that threatens to engulf Japan in destruction. With a budget of 259.4 million dollars, this visually stunning film, known for its vibrant colors, was released on December 12, 1992, and boasts a talented cast including Tetsuya Bessho, Satomi Kobayashi, Takehiro Murata, and Saburo Shinoda. At an average rating of 6.1, "Godzilla vs. Mothra" delivers 1 hour and 42 minutes of thrilling monster mayhem brought to life by Toho Pictures, Inc.

The original language of the movie is Japanese. The production company behind the film is Toho Pictures, Inc. The tagline for the movie is "Great battle of vibrant colors!" The production country is Japan.

title = Ted 
overview = John Bennett, a man whose childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life came true, now must decide between keeping the relationship with the bear or his girlfriend, Lori. 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Seth MacFarlane 
Producer = Seth MacFarlane 
date of release = the 29 of June 2012 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English language film "Ted," directed and produced by Seth MacFarlane, viewers are introduced to John Bennett, a man faced with a unique dilemma. After his childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life comes true, John must navigate the complexities of choosing between maintaining his close bond with the foul-mouthed, living teddy bear named Ted or prioritizing his relationship with his girlfriend, Lori. With a budget of 50.0 million dollars, this comedy was released on the 29th of June 2012, offering audiences a hilarious and heartwarming tale of friendship, love, and growing up.

title = Sun Valley Serenade 
overview = Skating star Sonja Henie and the Glenn Miller Orchestra share the spotlight in Sun Valley Serenade. Henie plays a Norwegian refugee adopted by band pianist John Payne, who mistakenly thought that the full-grown Miss Henie was a 10-year-old little girl. Payne's girlfriend, Lynn Bari, is a soloist with the Miller band, and also a violently jealous sort. When Bari quits Miller out of pique, Henie stages an elaborate ice show as a substitute. This impromptu spectacular thrills the audience at the Sun Valley resort hotel where most of the action takes place. Joan Davis and Milton Berle provide comic relief to the music and romance (you haven't lived until you've seen Berle on skis), while The Nicholas Brothers and Dorothy Dandridge perform a lively chorus of "Chattanooga Choo Choo." 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Sonja Henie, John Payne, Glenn Miller, Milton Berle 
budget = 161.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 193.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h26 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Sun Valley Serenade," skating star Sonja Henie takes center stage alongside the Glenn Miller Orchestra in a heartwarming tale set in the picturesque Sun Valley resort hotel. Adopted by band pianist John Payne, Henie's character faces comedic misunderstandings as she showcases her talent in an elaborate ice show. The romantic entanglements between Payne, his girlfriend played by Lynn Bari, and the musical performances by the iconic Glenn Miller Orchestra create a captivating atmosphere. With the added charm of comedic duo Joan Davis and Milton Berle, as well as the energetic performances of The Nicholas Brothers and Dorothy Dandridge, "Sun Valley Serenade" is a delightful blend of music, romance, and laughter. And let's not forget the thrilling ski antics of Milton Berle that add an extra layer of entertainment to this classic film.

The movie was produced in the United States of America and has a budget of 161.0 million dollars. It generated a revenue of 193.9 million dollars. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 26 minutes. The original language of the movie is English, and it has an average note of 6.0.

The cast includes Sonja Henie, John Payne, Glenn Miller, and Milton Berle. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Sonja Henie, John Payne, Glenn Miller, Milton Berle

Adopted by band pianist John Payne, Henie's character faces comedic misunderstandings as she showcases her talent in an elaborate ice show. The romantic entanglements between Payne, his girlfriend played by Lynn Bari, and the musical performances by the iconic Glenn Miller Orchestra create a captivating atmosphere. With the added charm of comedic duo Joan Davis and Milton Berle, as well as the energetic performances of The Nicholas Brothers and Dorothy Dandridge, "Sun Valley Serenade" is a delightful blend of music, romance, and laughter. And let's not forget the thrilling ski antics of Milton Berle that add an extra layer of entertainment to this classic film.

The movie was produced in the United States of America and has a budget of 161.0 million dollars. It generated a revenue of 193.9 million dollars. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 26 minutes. The original language of the movie is English, and it has an average note of 6.0.

The cast includes Sonja Henie, John Payne, Glenn Miller, and Milton Berle.

title = Hanna 
overview = A 16-year-old girl raised by her father to be the perfect assassin is dispatched on a mission across Europe. Tracked by a ruthless operatives, she faces startling revelations about her existence and questions about her humanity. 
revenue = 63.8 millions of dollars 
Director = Joe Wright 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 7 of April 2011 
production compagnie = Focus Features 
production countrie = Germany 
Producer = Leslie Holleran 
cast = Saoirse Ronan, Eric Bana, Vicky Krieps, Cate Blanchett 
duration of the movie = 1h51 
average note = 6.5 
tagline = Adapt or die. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 63.8 millions of dollars 

In "Hanna," directed by Joe Wright and released on the 7th of April 2011 by Focus Features, we follow the gripping story of a 16-year-old girl named Hanna, who was raised by her father to become a skilled assassin. As she embarks on a dangerous mission across Europe, she is pursued by relentless operatives, leading her to uncover shocking truths about her past and raising profound questions about her own humanity. Starring Saoirse Ronan, Eric Bana, Vicky Krieps, and Cate Blanchett, this action-packed thriller boasts a runtime of 1 hour and 51 minutes. With a budget of 30.0 million dollars, "Hanna" went on to earn 63.8 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 6.5. The tagline "Adapt or die" perfectly encapsulates the intense and suspenseful journey that unfolds in this German-produced film, produced by Leslie Holleran. The production company behind "Hanna" is Focus Features, and the movie was primarily filmed in Germany.

title = A Good Year 
overview = Failed London banker Max Skinner inherits his uncle's vineyard in Provence, where he spent many childhood holidays. Upon his arrival, he meets a woman from California who tells Max she is his long-lost cousin and that the property is hers. 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h58 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Ridley Scott 
budget = 35.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.5 
revenue = 42.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Fox 2000 Pictures 
date of release = the 9 of September 2006 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the charming movie "A Good Year," directed by Ridley Scott, we follow the journey of Max Skinner, a failed London banker who unexpectedly inherits his uncle's vineyard in Provence, where he spent many childhood holidays. Upon his arrival, he meets a woman from California who tells Max she is his long-lost cousin and that the property is hers. As Max navigates the unfamiliar world of winemaking, he encounters a woman claiming to be his long-lost cousin and the rightful owner of the property. Set against the picturesque backdrop of the French countryside, Max must confront his past and decide the future of the vineyard. With a runtime of 1 hour and 58 minutes, this delightful film was released on September 9, 2006, in the United States. Despite its budget of 35.0 million dollars, "A Good Year" managed to earn a revenue of 42.1 million dollars, receiving an average rating of 6.5. Produced by Fox 2000 Pictures, this heartwarming tale is sure to captivate audiences with its blend of romance, humor, and stunning scenery.

['correct']

Upon his arrival, he meets a woman from California who tells Max she is his long-lost cousin and that the property is hers. As Max navigates the unfamiliar world of winemaking, he encounters a woman claiming to be his long-lost cousin and the rightful owner of the property. Set against the picturesque backdrop of the French countryside, Max must confront his past and decide the future of the vineyard. With a runtime of 1 hour and 58 minutes, this delightful film was released on September 9, 2006, in the United States. Despite its budget of 35.0 million dollars, "A Good Year" managed to earn a revenue of 42.1 million dollars, receiving an average rating of 6.5. Produced by Fox 2000 Pictures, this heartwarming tale is sure to captivate audiences with its blend of romance, humor, and stunning scenery. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 42.1 millions of dollars 

In the charming movie "A Good Year," directed by Ridley Scott, we follow the journey of Max Skinner, a failed London banker who unexpectedly inherits his uncle's vineyard in Provence, where he spent many childhood holidays. Upon his arrival, he meets a woman from California who tells Max she is his long-lost cousin and that the property is hers. As Max navigates the unfamiliar world of winemaking, he encounters a woman claiming to be his long-lost cousin and the rightful owner of the property. title = Getaway 
overview = Former race car driver Brent Magna (Hawke) is pitted against the clock. Desperately trying to save the life of his kidnapped wife, Brent commandeers a custom Ford Shelby GT500 Super Snake, taking it and its unwitting owner (Gomez) on a high-speed race against time, at the command of the mysterious villain holding his wife hostage. 
cast = Ethan Hawke, Selena Gomez, Jon Voight, Paul Freeman 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
revenue = 10.5 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 29 of August 2013 
tagline = Get in. Get out. Getaway. 
average note = 4.9 
Producer = Moshe Diamant 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Bulgaria 
Director = Courtney Solomon 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Ethan Hawke, Selena Gomez, Jon Voight, Paul Freeman 

In "Getaway," former race car driver Brent Magna, portrayed by Ethan Hawke, finds himself in a high-stakes race against time to save his kidnapped wife. With the help of an unwitting owner, played by Selena Gomez, Brent commandeers a custom Ford Shelby GT500 Super Snake in a desperate attempt to outmaneuver a mysterious villain, portrayed by Jon Voight. Directed by Courtney Solomon and produced by Moshe Diamant, this action-packed thriller takes viewers on a heart-pounding journey through the streets of Bulgaria. As the clock ticks, tensions rise, and the tagline "Get in. Get out. Getaway." sets the tone for this adrenaline-fueled ride. Released on August 29, 2013, this 1 hour and 30-minute film grossed 10.5 million dollars at the box office, captivating audiences with its fast-paced plot and intense performances. The cast also includes Paul Freeman. The original language of the movie is English. The production country is Bulgaria. The average note for the movie is 4.9.

title = The Mummy 
overview = Dashing legionnaire Rick O'Connell and his companion, Beni stumble upon the hidden ruins of Hamunaptra while in the midst of a battle in 1923, 3,000 years after Imhotep has suffered a fate worse than death – his body will remain undead for all eternity as a punishment for a forbidden love. 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Stephen Sommers 
date of release = the 16 of April 1999 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the action-packed adventure film "The Mummy," directed by Stephen Sommers and released on the 16th of April 1999, we follow the story of dashing legionnaire Rick O'Connell and his companion, Beni, as they stumble upon the hidden ruins of Hamunaptra in 1923. Little do they know, they have awakened Imhotep, who has suffered a fate worse than death for his forbidden love 3,000 years ago. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, this movie takes viewers on a thrilling journey filled with ancient curses, undead creatures, and a race against time to stop the malevolent mummy from unleashing chaos upon the world.

title = Cries and Whispers 
overview = When a woman dying of cancer in turn-of-the century Sweden is visited by her two sisters, long repressed feelings between the siblings rise to the surface. 
Producer = Ingmar Bergman 
production compagnie = Cinematograph AB 
revenue = 241.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Ingmar Bergman 

In the emotionally charged film "Cries and Whispers," produced by the legendary Ingmar Bergman and brought to life by Cinematograph AB, we are transported to turn-of-the-century Sweden. Here, a woman battling cancer receives a visit from her two sisters, leading to the unraveling of long-suppressed emotions and buried secrets. As the sisters confront their past and present conflicts, the poignant narrative unfolds against a backdrop of stunning cinematography and powerful performances. With a remarkable revenue of 241.6 million dollars, this film not only captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of familial dynamics but also proves to be a commercial success.

['correct']

Here, a woman battling cancer receives a visit from her two sisters, leading to the unraveling of long-suppressed emotions and buried secrets. As the sisters confront their past and present conflicts, the poignant narrative unfolds against a backdrop of stunning cinematography and powerful performances. With a remarkable revenue of 241.6 million dollars, this film not only captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of familial dynamics but also proves to be a commercial success.

title = Midaq Alley 
overview = Heated tempers, frustrated desires and dashed hopes plague a diverse group of individuals whose lives cross paths in Mexico City. There is the bar-owner's son, Chava, who yearns to emigrate to America. A poor barber, Abel, is madly in love with the gorgeous Alma, who eventually becomes a high-class prostitute. Finally, there is Susanita, the desperate spinster who pursues many love affairs in hopes of finding a husband. 
cast = Ernesto Gómez Cruz, María Rojo, Salma Hayek, Bruno Bichir 
production compagnie = Alameda Films 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
average note = 6.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Ernesto Gómez Cruz, María Rojo, Salma Hayek, Bruno Bichir 

In the bustling streets of Mexico City's Midaq Alley, a tapestry of intertwined lives unfolds, each character grappling with their own dreams and disappointments. Chava, the ambitious son of a bar-owner, dreams of a better life in America, while Abel, a humble barber, pines for the love of the enchanting Alma, whose path leads her to a different destiny as a high-class prostitute. Finally, there is Susanita, a lovelorn spinster seeking companionship in a series of fleeting romances. 

Starring Ernesto Gómez Cruz, María Rojo, Salma Hayek, and Bruno Bichir, this Alameda Films production captures the essence of human longing and resilience in the original Spanish language, earning an average note of 6.4.

title = Into the White 
overview = Into the White is an anti-war movie. High above the harsh Norwegian wilderness, English and German pilots shoot each other to the ground after a violent chance encounter. Isolated, they must fight to survive the brutal winter. Though war has made them enemies, antagonism is hard to maintain as days go by. Through mutual need, unlikely friendships bloom. Somehow, they become comrades. War, after all, is absurd. 
average note = 6.9 
production countrie = Norway 
tagline = Inspired by the true world war II story. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Petter Næss 
Producer = Peter Aalbæk Jensen 
revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Stig Henrik Hoff, Lachlan Nieboer, Rupert Grint, Florian Lukas 
date of release = the 6 of March 2012 
budget = 113.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production compagnie = Trollhättan Film AB 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.9 

In "Into the White," directed by Petter Næss and released on the 6th of March 2012, viewers are taken on a gripping journey high above the harsh Norwegian wilderness during World War II. The film, inspired by a true story, follows English and German pilots who find themselves forced to work together to survive after shooting each other down. As they navigate the brutal winter and the absurdity of war, unlikely friendships blossom among the cast including Stig Henrik Hoff, Lachlan Nieboer, Rupert Grint, and Florian Lukas. Despite being an anti-war movie, the camaraderie that develops between the characters challenges the enmity that brought them together in the first place. With a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, "Into the White" is a poignant reminder of the human connections that can transcend even the most dire circumstances. This English-language film from Norway, produced by Trollhättan Film AB and Peter Aalbæk Jensen, received an average rating of 6.9 and had a budget of 113.5 million dollars, though it did not generate any revenue at the box office. The tagline of the movie is "Inspired by the true world war II story."

In the action-packed film "Mercenaries," directed by Christopher Ray and produced by Paul Bales, a diplomatic official finds herself in a perilous situation when she is captured and imprisoned during a tour of a war zone. To rescue her, a team of elite female commandos, including Zoë Bell, Kristanna Loken, Vivica A. Fox, and Brigitte Nielsen, is assembled. Their mission? Infiltrate a women's prison for a daring rescue operation. With a tagline that declares "They're the Best Man for the job," this United States of America production by The Asylum delivers thrills and excitement. Released on the 5th of August 2014, the movie garnered an average rating of 4.3 and raked in a revenue of 38.0 million dollars, despite having a budget of 185.8 million dollars. With a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes, "Mercenaries" is an intense and action-packed adventure in English.

title = Salome 
overview = In the reign of emperor Tiberius, Gallilean prophet John the Baptist preaches against King Herod and Queen Herodias. The latter wants John dead, but Herod fears to harm him due to a prophecy. Enter beautiful Princess Salome, Herod's long-absent stepdaughter. Herodias sees the king's dawning lust for Salome as her means of bending the king to her will. But Salome and her lover Claudius are (contrary to Scripture) nearing conversion to the new religion. And the famous climactic dance turns out to have unexpected implications... 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct.']
fact : tagline = The Glory And Excitement Of Rome...In All Its Greatness and Badness! 

In the historical drama "Salome," set in the reign of emperor Tiberius, the Gallilean prophet John the Baptist boldly speaks out against King Herod and Queen Herodias. Despite Herodias' strong desire to see John dead, Herod hesitates to harm him due to a prophecy. The intricate power dynamics shift when Princess Salome, Herod's striking stepdaughter, reappears after a long absence. As Herodias manipulates the king's growing infatuation with Salome to her advantage, a forbidden love story between Salome and Claudius unfolds, challenging traditional beliefs. The tension escalates towards the famous climactic dance, leading to unforeseen consequences that change the course of their lives forever.

Facts included in the description:
1. The story is set in the reign of emperor Tiberius.
2. John the Baptist preaches against King Herod and Queen Herodias.
3. Queen Herodias wants John the Baptist dead.
4. Herod hesitates to harm John due to a prophecy.
5. Princess Salome is Herod's stepdaughter.
6. Herodias manipulates the king's infatuation with Salome.
7. Salome is in a forbidden love story with Claudius.
8. Salome and Claudius are nearing conversion to a new religion.
9. The famous climactic dance has unexpected implications.

title = Alice 
overview = A quiet young English girl named Alice finds herself in an alternate version of her own reality after chasing a white rabbit. She becomes surrounded by living inanimate objects and stuffed dead animals, and must find a way out of this nightmare- no matter how twisted or odd that way must be. A memorably bizarre screen version of Lewis Carroll’s novel ‘Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland’. 
Producer = Peter-Christian Fueter 
Director = Jan Švankmajer 
production compagnie = Channel Four Films 
date of release = the 3 of August 1988 
tagline = A film made for children… perhaps? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Peter-Christian Fueter 

In the surreal and captivating film "Alice," directed by Jan Švankmajer and produced by Peter-Christian Fueter, a quiet young English girl named Alice embarks on a mind-bending journey after following a white rabbit into an alternate reality. Surrounded by living inanimate objects and stuffed dead animals, Alice must navigate through this twisted nightmare to find her way back home. Released on the 3rd of August 1988 by Channel Four Films, this memorably bizarre adaptation of Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" challenges the boundaries of reality and imagination. With a tagline that questions if it's truly a film made for children, "Alice" promises a unique and unforgettable cinematic experience.

In the surreal and captivating film "Alice," directed by Jan Švankmajer and produced by Peter-Christian Fueter, a quiet young English girl named Alice embarks on a mind-bending journey after following a white rabbit into an alternate reality. Surrounded by living inanimate objects and stuffed dead animals, Alice must navigate through this twisted nightmare to find her way back home. Released on the 3rd of August 1988 by Channel Four Films, this memorably bizarre adaptation of Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" challenges the boundaries of reality and imagination. With a tagline that questions if it's truly a film made for children, "Alice" promises a unique and unforgettable cinematic experience.

title = The Tales of Hoffmann 
overview = Hoffmann is a lovelorn young man in Nuremberg who is watching his latest love, Stella, dance in the ballet. In the interval he goes to the tavern where he tells his friends the tales of the three major loves of his life. Each story forms a separate act of this filmic version of the Offenbach opera. 
revenue = 220.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Moira Shearer, Ludmilla Tchérina, Pamela Brown, Léonide Massine 
average note = 6.4 
date of release = the 4 of April 1951 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 220.2 millions of dollars 

In the enchanting film "The Tales of Hoffmann," we follow the journey of a heartbroken young man named Hoffmann in Nuremberg. As he watches his beloved Stella dance in the ballet, he reminisces about the three great loves of his life, sharing each tale with his friends at a local tavern. Portrayed by a talented cast including Moira Shearer, Ludmilla Tchérina, Pamela Brown, and Léonide Massine, each love story unfolds as a separate act in this cinematic adaptation of the Offenbach opera. Released on the 4th of April 1951, this visually stunning film captivated audiences worldwide and grossed an impressive $220.2 million in revenue. With an average rating of 6.4, "The Tales of Hoffmann" weaves a mesmerizing tapestry of love, passion, and artistry that continues to resonate with viewers to this day.

['correct']
fact : cast = Moira Shearer, Ludmilla Tchérina, Pamela Brown, Léonide Massine

title = The Back-Up Plan 
overview = When Zoe tires of looking for Mr. Right, she decides to have a baby on her own. But on the day she's artificially inseminated, she meets Stan, who seems to be just who she's been searching for all her life. Now, Zoe has to figure out how to make her two life's dreams fit with each other. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.7 
date of release = the 23 of April 2010 
revenue = 77.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Escape Artists 
Director = Alan Poul 
tagline = Fall in love, get married, have a baby. Not necessarily in that order. 
duration of the movie = 1h46 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Back-Up Plan," Zoe, tired of searching for Mr. Right, takes matters into her own hands and decides to have a baby through artificial insemination. However, on the same day, she unexpectedly meets Stan, who appears to be the perfect match she's been seeking. As Zoe navigates the complexities of balancing her newfound relationship with her long-standing dream of motherhood, she must find a way to merge the two paths she never expected to intersect. Directed by Alan Poul and released on April 23, 2010, this English-language film produced by Escape Artists explores the unconventional journey of love, family, and self-discovery. With an average rating of 5.7 and grossing $77.5 million in revenue, "The Back-Up Plan" challenges the traditional notions of falling in love, getting married, and having a baby, reminding us that life doesn't always follow a predetermined order. The movie has a runtime of 1 hour and 46 minutes. The tagline for the film is "Fall in love, get married, have a baby. Not necessarily in that order."

title = The End 
overview = Wendell Lawson has only six months to live. Not wanting to endure his last few months of life waiting for the end, he decides to take matters into his own hands and enlists the help of a delusional mental patient to help him commit suicide. 
production compagnie = United Artists 
average note = 5.7 
budget = 169.4 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 10 of May 1978 
Producer = Lawrence Gordon 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Are there laughs before death? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = United Artists 

In "The End," Wendell Lawson, facing a terminal diagnosis with only six months to live, refuses to passively wait for the inevitable. Instead, he embarks on a darkly comedic journey to take control of his own fate. Teaming up with a delusional mental patient, Wendell sets out on a mission to end his life on his own terms. Produced by Lawrence Gordon and released on May 10, 1978, by United Artists, this English-language film poses the question: "Are there laughs before death?" With an average rating of 5.7 and a budget of a staggering $169.4 million, "The End" promises a unique and thought-provoking exploration of mortality and the choices we make in the face of it. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.7 

In "The End," Wendell Lawson, facing a terminal diagnosis with only six months to live, refuses to passively wait for the inevitable. Instead, he embarks on a darkly comedic journey to take control of his own fate. Teaming up with a delusional mental patient, Wendell sets out on a mission to end his life on his own terms. Produced by Lawrence Gordon and released on May 10, 1978, by United Artists, this English-language film poses the question: "Are there laughs before death?" With an average rating of 5.7 and a budget of a staggering $169.4 million, "The End" promises a unique and thought-provoking exploration of mortality and the choices we make in the face of it.

title = Jersey Girl 
overview = Ollie Trinke is a young, suave music publicist who seems to have it all, with a new wife and a baby on the way. But life deals him a bum hand when he's suddenly faced with single fatherhood, a defunct career and having to move in with his father. To bounce back, it takes a new love and the courage instilled in him by his daughter. 
revenue = 36.1 millions of dollars

Forced to live with his father, Ollie finds solace and strength in the love of his daughter. As he strives to bounce back, a new romance and the unwavering courage inspired by his child lead him on a journey of self-discovery. This heartwarming tale of resilience and love grossed an impressive $36.1 million at the box office.

title = Stitches 
overview = The clumsy and unfunny clown Richard "Stitches" Grindle entertains at the 10th birthday party of little Tom, but the boy and his friends play a prank with Stitches, tying his shoelaces. Stitches slips, falls and dies. Six years later, Tom gives a birthday party for his friends at home, but Stitches revives to haunt the teenagers and revenge his death. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = You'll die laughing... 

In the horror-comedy film "Stitches," the clumsy and unfunny clown Richard "Stitches" Grindle meets a tragic end at a 10th birthday party. After a fatal accident caused by a prank gone wrong, Stitches is laid to rest. Six years later, during Tom's birthday party, the clown unexpectedly returns from the grave seeking vengeance on the now-teenage partygoers. As Stitches haunts the group, chaos ensues, and the teenagers must confront their past actions in a fight for survival against the vengeful clown.

title = Corpse Bride 
overview = Set in a 19th-century european village, this stop-motion animation feature follows the story of Victor, a young man whisked away to the underworld and wed to a mysterious corpse bride, while his real bride Victoria waits bereft in the land of the living. 
duration of the movie = 1h17 
Producer = Tim Burton 
revenue = 117.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 40.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tim Burton 
tagline = There's been a grave misunderstanding. 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
average note = 7.2 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 9 of September 2005 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h17 

In the 19th-century European village, a young man named Victor finds himself in a peculiar situation when he is unexpectedly taken to the underworld and forced into marriage with a mysterious corpse bride. Meanwhile, his true love, Victoria, remains heartbroken in the land of the living. Directed by the renowned Tim Burton, "Corpse Bride" is a captivating stop-motion animation film that explores love, loss, and the supernatural. With a runtime of 1 hour and 17 minutes, this English-language movie was released on the 9th of September 2005 by Warner Bros. The film, with a budget of $40 million, went on to gross an impressive $117.2 million at the box office. As the tagline suggests, "There's been a grave misunderstanding," adding a touch of dark humor to this enchanting tale. The movie was produced by Tim Burton and received an average rating of 7.2. It was produced in the United States of America.

['correct']

With a runtime of 1 hour and 17 minutes, this English-language movie was released on the 9th of September 2005 by Warner Bros. The film, with a budget of $40 million, went on to gross an impressive $117.2 million at the box office. As the tagline suggests, "There's been a grave misunderstanding," adding a touch of dark humor to this enchanting tale. The movie was produced by Tim Burton and received an average rating of 7.2. It was produced in the United States of America.

title = Apt Pupil 
overview = Neighborhood boy Todd Bowden discovers that an old man living on his block named Arthur Denker is nazi war criminal. Bowden confronts Denker and offers him a deal: Bowden will not go to the authorities if Denker tells him stories of the concentration camps in WWII... 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = If you don't believe in the existence of evil, you've got a lot to learn. 

In the intense thriller "Apt Pupil," neighborhood boy Todd Bowden stumbles upon a shocking revelation about his elderly neighbor Arthur Denker - he is a Nazi war criminal. Instead of turning him in to the authorities, Bowden strikes a chilling deal with Denker. In exchange for Bowden's silence, Denker must recount harrowing tales of the atrocities he committed during WWII in concentration camps. As their twisted relationship unfolds, dark secrets and sinister motives come to light, blurring the lines between predator and prey.

title = Goldstone 
overview = Indigenous detective Jay Swan arrives in the frontier town of "Goldstone" on a missing persons inquiry. What seems like a simple "light duties" investigation opens into a web of crime and corruption. Jay must pull his life together and bury his differences with young local cop Josh, so together they can bring justice to Goldstone. 
date of release = the 7 of July 2016 
tagline = THE SEQUEL TO MYSTERY ROAD 
duration of the movie = 1h49 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 7 of July 2016 

In the thrilling sequel to "Mystery Road," titled "Goldstone," Indigenous detective Jay Swan is called to the frontier town of Goldstone to investigate a missing persons case. What starts as a seemingly routine inquiry quickly unravels into a complex network of crime and corruption. Jay must navigate his own personal struggles and reconcile with local cop Josh to uncover the truth and bring justice to Goldstone. Released on the 7th of July 2016, this gripping film runs for 1 hour and 49 minutes, promising a riveting blend of mystery, drama, and action. Don't miss out on this intense journey into the heart of Goldstone.

title = Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure 
overview = In the small town of San Dimas, a few miles away from Los Angeles, there are two nearly brain dead teenage boys going by the names of Bill S, Preston ESQ. and Ted Theodore Logan, they have a dream together of starting their own rock and roll band called the "Wyld Stallyns". Unfortunately, they are still in high school and on the verge of failing out of their school as well, and if they do not pass their upcoming history report, they will be separated as a result of Ted's father sending him to military school. But, what Bill and Ted do not know is that they must stay together to save the future. So, a man from the future named Rufus came to help them pass their report. So, both Bill and Ted decided to gather up historical figures which they need for their report. They are hoping that this will help them pass their report so they can stay together. 
production compagnie = Orion Pictures 
tagline = History is about to be rewritten by two guys who can't spell. 
cast = Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, George Carlin, Dan Shor 
duration of the movie = 1h30 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Orion Pictures 

In the small town of San Dimas, a few miles away from Los Angeles, there are two nearly brain dead teenage boys going by the names of Bill S. Preston ESQ. and Ted Theodore Logan, they have a dream together of starting their own rock and roll band called the "Wyld Stallyns". Unfortunately, they are still in high school and on the verge of failing out of their school as well, and if they do not pass their upcoming history report, they will be separated as a result of Ted's father sending him to military school. But, what Bill and Ted do not know is that they must stay together to save the future. So, a man from the future named Rufus came to help them pass their report. So, both Bill and Ted decided to gather up historical figures which they need for their report. They are hoping that this will help them pass their report so they can stay together.

"Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure" is a 1h30 Orion Pictures production that follows the journey of Bill and Ted, played by Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter, as they travel through time with the help of Rufus, portrayed by George Carlin. Along the way, they encounter iconic historical figures like Napoleon and Socrates, all in a quest to pass their history report and secure their future together. This wild and hilarious ride is filled with rock and roll dreams, time-traveling antics, and a mission to rewrite history. Don't miss out on this adventure where history is about to be rewritten by two guys who can't spell.

The movie also features Dan Shor in its cast.

['correct']
fact : tagline = History is about to be rewritten by two guys who can't spell.

In the small town of San Dimas, a few miles away from Los Angeles, there are two nearly brain dead teenage boys going by the names of Bill S. Preston ESQ. and Ted Theodore Logan, they have a dream together of starting their own rock and roll band called the "Wyld Stallyns". Unfortunately, they are still in high school and on the verge of failing out of their school as well, and if they do not pass their upcoming history report, they will be separated as a result of Ted's father sending him to military school. But, what Bill and Ted do not know is that they must stay together to save the future. So, a man from the future named Rufus came to help them pass their report. So, both Bill and Ted decided to gather up historical figures which they need for their report. They are hoping that this will help them pass their report so they can stay together.

"Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure" is a 1h30 Orion Pictures production that follows the journey of Bill and Ted, played by Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter, as they travel through time with the help of Rufus, portrayed by George Carlin. Along the way, they encounter iconic historical figures like Napoleon and Socrates, all in a quest to pass their history report and secure their future together. This wild and hilarious ride is filled with rock and roll dreams, time-traveling antics, and a mission to rewrite history. Don't miss out on this adventure where history is about to be rewritten by two guys who can't spell.

The movie also features Dan Shor in its cast.

title = Undiscovered 
overview = A group of aspiring entertainers try to establish careers for themselves in the city of Los Angeles. 
production compagnie = Lakeshore Entertainment 
tagline = They Know Each Other By Heart. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Gary Lucchesi 
average note = 4.5 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Meiert Avis 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Lakeshore Entertainment 

In the bustling city of Los Angeles, a group of aspiring entertainers navigate the cutthroat world of show business in "Undiscovered." Directed by Meiert Avis and produced by Gary Lucchesi, this film follows the intertwined lives of these hopefuls as they strive to make a name for themselves in the entertainment industry. With a tagline that reads "They Know Each Other By Heart," the movie captures the bonds formed among the characters as they chase their dreams. Produced by Lakeshore Entertainment in the United States of America, "Undiscovered" is a tale of ambition, friendship, and the pursuit of success, all set against the backdrop of the City of Angels. The original language of the movie is English, and it has an average rating of 4.5.

title = Look Back in Anger 
overview = A disillusioned, angry university graduate comes to terms with his grudge against middle-class life and values. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
revenue = 42.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
average note = 7.1 
date of release = the 28 of May 1959 
production compagnie = Woodfall Film Productions 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = An electrifying adult experience... from the sensational play by John Osborne that shocked the world! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the critically acclaimed film "Look Back in Anger," produced by Woodfall Film Productions in the United Kingdom, a disillusioned university graduate grapples with his resentment towards middle-class life and values. Released on the 28th of May 1959, this electrifying movie, based on the sensational play by John Osborne, delves into themes of anger and disillusionment. With a runtime of 1 hour and 38 minutes, the film garnered a revenue of 42.8 million dollars and an average rating of 7.1. Experience the raw emotions and powerful performances in this English-language masterpiece that continues to resonate with audiences to this day. Don't miss out on this gripping exploration of societal discontent and personal turmoil.

title = Creature 
overview = A crew of scientists arrives on a far, cold planet to examine archaic artifacts of unknown origin. They discover that their German enemies already have a ship there. When they seek their help after a failed landing, they only find the Germans’ bodies, obviously slaughtered by one of the archaic creatures, awoken to new life. Now the alien is after them. 
revenue = 220.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = William Malone 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 220.0 millions of dollars 

In the chilling sci-fi thriller "Creature," a team of scientists embarks on a mission to a distant, icy planet to investigate mysterious ancient relics. However, their expedition takes a terrifying turn when they encounter the remains of a German crew who fell victim to a monstrous creature awakened from its slumber. As the alien predator sets its sights on the scientists, a deadly game of survival ensues. Produced by William Malone and grossing an impressive $220 million, this heart-pounding film unfolds in its original language of English, delivering thrills and suspense at every turn.

title = The Answer 
overview = When mailman Bridd Takes his sexy date Charlotte home, they find their boss on the floor with a mail opener stuck in his chest. The assailants are also after Bridd and he has to use all his talents to foil an extra-terrestrial complot. 

In "The Answer," mailman Bridd takes his date Charlotte home, only to discover their boss lying on the floor with a mail opener lodged in his chest. As they unravel the mystery, they realize that they are being targeted by assailants who are not of this world. Bridd must now utilize all of his skills and abilities to thwart an extraterrestrial plot that threatens not only their lives but the fate of humanity itself.

title = The Descent: Part 2 
overview = Distraught, confused, and half-wild with fear, Sarah Carter emerges alone from the Appalachian cave system where she encountered unspeakable terrors. Unable to plausibly explain to the authorities what happened - or why she's covered in her friends' blood - Sarah is forced back to the subterranean depths to help locate her five missing companions. 
average note = 6.0 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Shauna Macdonald, Natalie Mendoza, Gavin O'Herlihy, Krysten Cummings 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
tagline = Fear runs deeper 
production compagnie = Celador Films 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
date of release = the 14 of October 2009 
revenue = 226.6 millions of dollars 
Director = Jon Harris 
budget = 146.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.0 

In "The Descent: Part 2," directed by Jon Harris, the harrowing tale continues as Sarah Carter, portrayed by Shauna Macdonald, emerges from the Appalachian cave system traumatized and alone. Covered in her friends' blood, she must return to the underground depths to aid in the search for her missing companions, including Natalie Mendoza, Gavin O'Herlihy, and Krysten Cummings. As fear grips her and the authorities question her account, Sarah's descent into darkness becomes a desperate struggle for survival. With an average rating of 6.0, this English-language film from Celador Films takes viewers on a chilling journey where the true horrors lie beneath the surface. Remember, fear runs deeper in this intense thriller released on October 14, 2009, which grossed a staggering $226.6 million against a budget of $146.8 million. The tagline for the movie is "Fear runs deeper." The production company behind the film is Celador Films, and it was produced in the United Kingdom.

title = The Mad Magician 
overview = Vincent Price plays Gallico the great, an inventor of stage-magic effects who aspires to become a star in his own right. Just before his first performance, his act is shut down by capricious manager Ormond who wants Gallico's brilliant buzzsaw effect for the act of the Great Rinaldi, an established star. With this defeat, and the humiliation of having already lost his wife Claire to his rival, Gallico goes insane and uses the buzzsaw to decapitate his manager. 
cast = Vincent Price, Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, John Emery 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Vincent Price, Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, John Emery 

In "The Mad Magician," Vincent Price portrays Gallico the great, a talented inventor of stage-magic effects who dreams of achieving stardom. His ambitions are thwarted when his act is abruptly halted by his manager Ormond, who is determined to steal Gallico's innovative buzzsaw effect for the renowned performer, the Great Rinaldi. As Gallico grapples with this betrayal and the heartbreak of losing his wife Claire to his rival, he descends into madness. In a chilling turn of events, Gallico uses the buzzsaw to gruesomely decapitate his manager. This thrilling tale of jealousy and revenge stars Vincent Price alongside Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, and John Emery. 

Cast: Vincent Price, Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, John Emery 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = 3D THRILL! Fuel for the human bonfire!

As Gallico grapples with this betrayal and the heartbreak of losing his wife Claire to his rival, he descends into madness. In a chilling turn of events, Gallico uses the buzzsaw to gruesomely decapitate his manager. This thrilling tale of jealousy and revenge stars Vincent Price alongside Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, and John Emery. 

Cast: Vincent Price, Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, John Emery

['correct']
fact : Director = John Brahm 

In "The Mad Magician," Vincent Price portrays Gallico the great, a talented inventor of stage-magic effects who dreams of achieving stardom. His ambitions are thwarted when his act is abruptly halted by his manager Ormond, who is determined to steal Gallico's innovative buzzsaw effect for the renowned performer, the Great Rinaldi. As Gallico grapples with this betrayal and the heartbreak of losing his wife Claire to his rival, he descends into madness. In a chilling turn of events, Gallico uses the buzzsaw to gruesomely decapitate his manager. This thrilling tale of jealousy and revenge stars Vincent Price alongside Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, and John Emery. 

Cast: Vincent Price, Mary Murphy, Eva Gabor, John Emery

title = Honey, We Shrunk Ourselves 
overview = The joke's on absent-minded scientist Wayne Szalinski when his troublesome invention shrinks him, his brother and their wives so effectively that their children think they've completely disappeared. Of course, this gives the kids free rein to do anything they want, unaware that their parents are watching every move. 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
cast = Rick Moranis, Eve Gordon, Bug Hall, Robin Bartlett 
average note = 5.1 
duration of the movie = 1h14 
budget = 7.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 18 of March 1997 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 

In "Honey, We Shrunk Ourselves," a hilarious mishap occurs when scientist Wayne Szalinski's invention accidentally shrinks him, his brother, and their wives to miniature size. As the adults navigate their now tiny world, their children believe they have vanished, leading to a series of mischievous adventures. With the Walt Disney Pictures touch, this family-friendly film stars Rick Moranis, Eve Gordon, Bug Hall, and Robin Bartlett. Despite its modest budget of 7.0 million dollars, the movie managed to captivate audiences upon its release on the 18th of March 1997. With an average rating of 5.1, this 1 hour and 14-minute comedy is a delightful journey into a downsized world of fun and imagination.

title = My Blood Runs Cold 
overview = Wealthy, reckless Californian Julie Merriday, accompanied by her boyfriend Harry Lindsay, an attorney, narrowly avoids crashing into a motorcycle driven by young Ben Gunther. Ben temporarily abandons his damaged cycle and accepts a ride from Julie but insists upon calling her Barbara. Later, at the Merriday beach house, Julie's Aunt Sarah tells Julie that her great great grandmother was named Barbara, and furthermore, that ancestress had an illegitimate child fathered by one Benjamin Gunther. 
date of release = the 24 of March 1965 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
Producer = William Conrad 
cast = Troy Donahue, Joey Heatherton, Barry Sullivan, Nicolas Coster 
revenue = 173.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = William Conrad Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of March 1965 

In the 1965 film "My Blood Runs Cold," wealthy and reckless Californian Julie Merriday narrowly avoids a motorcycle accident with young Ben Gunther, who mysteriously mistakes her for someone named Barbara. As Julie delves into her family history, she uncovers a shocking secret involving her great great grandmother and an illegitimate child fathered by a man named Benjamin Gunther. With a star-studded cast including Troy Donahue, Joey Heatherton, Barry Sullivan, and Nicolas Coster, this suspenseful drama produced by William Conrad takes viewers on a thrilling journey through deception and betrayal. With a box office revenue of 173.4 million dollars, this American production is a must-watch for fans of classic cinema. The film was released on the 24th of March 1965 and has a duration of 1 hour and 44 minutes. It was produced by William Conrad Productions in the United States of America.

title = The Final Cut 
overview = Mysterious bomber is planting explosive devices in Seattle. Since their quality takes too big a toll among Seattle Police bomb experts, John Pierce, former head of the Bomb Squad, reluctantly takes the job that will take him to face his worst nightmare. 
tagline = Three seconds.   Two wires.  One out.  No mistakes. 
production countrie = Canada 
cast = Sam Elliott, Charles Martin Smith, Kelly Benson, Anne Ramsay 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = William Vince 
date of release = the 1 of March 1996 
budget = 184.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Keystone Entertainment 
Director = Roger Christian 
average note = 7.3 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
revenue = 0.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Three seconds.   Two wires.  One out.  No mistakes. 

In the heart-pounding thriller "The Final Cut," former head of the Seattle Police Bomb Squad, John Pierce (played by Sam Elliott), is reluctantly pulled back into the dangerous world of bomb defusal when a mysterious bomber begins terrorizing the city. With explosive devices wreaking havoc and the clock ticking, Pierce must confront his worst nightmare as he races against time to prevent further devastation. Directed by Roger Christian and produced by William Vince, this gripping film takes viewers on a suspenseful ride filled with tension and adrenaline. With a stellar cast including Charles Martin Smith, Kelly Benson, and Anne Ramsay, "The Final Cut" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats with its intense storyline and high-stakes action. Will Pierce be able to disarm the bombs in time, or will Seattle face its darkest hour? Find out in this pulse-pounding thriller set against the backdrop of a city on the brink. Remember, in this high-stakes game, it's all about "Three seconds. Two wires. One out. No mistakes."

The movie was released on the 1st of March 1996 in Canada by Keystone Entertainment. It was filmed in English and had a budget of 184.1 million dollars. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 36 minutes and received an average rating of 7.3. Despite its critical acclaim, the movie generated a revenue of 0.6 million dollars. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']

The movie was released on the 1st of March 1996 in Canada by Keystone Entertainment. It was filmed in English and had a budget of 184.1 million dollars. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 36 minutes and received an average rating of 7.3. Despite its critical acclaim, the movie generated a revenue of 0.6 million dollars.

fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the heart-pounding thriller "The Final Cut," former head of the Seattle Police Bomb Squad, John Pierce (played by Sam Elliott), is reluctantly pulled back into the dangerous world of bomb defusal when a mysterious bomber begins terrorizing the city. With explosive devices wreaking havoc and the clock ticking, Pierce must confront his worst nightmare as he races against time to prevent further devastation. Directed by Roger Christian and produced by William Vince, this gripping film takes viewers on a suspenseful ride filled with tension and adrenaline. With a stellar cast including Charles Martin Smith, Kelly Benson, and Anne Ramsay, "The Final Cut" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats with its intense storyline and high-stakes action. Will Pierce be able to disarm the bombs in time, or will Seattle face its darkest hour? Find out in this pulse-pounding thriller set against the backdrop of a city on the brink. title = The Man Who Haunted Himself 
overview = Harold Pelham, a partner in a large electronics firm, finds himself in bewildering circumstances after recovering from a near-fatal car accident. What causes him to renounce his high business principles? Why do friends and colleagues repeatedly sight him in places he has never been? And why does Julie, an attractive girl he has seen only once, claim such an intimate relationship with him? Does Pelham really have a doppelganger – or is he losing his mind? 
date of release = the 18 of February 1970 
budget = 0.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Roger Moore, Anton Rodgers, Olga Georges-Picot, Freddie Jones 
revenue = 175.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
average note = 6.7 
tagline = You will live every shattering moment of terror with... The Man Who Haunted Himself 
Producer = Michael Relph 
production compagnie = Excalibur Films 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 18 of February 1970 

In the psychological thriller "The Man Who Haunted Himself," released on the 18th of February 1970 in the United Kingdom, Harold Pelham, portrayed by Roger Moore, is a successful partner in a large electronics firm. After surviving a near-fatal car accident, he finds himself in a perplexing situation where he starts to question his own identity. As he grapples with inexplicable occurrences and encounters, such as friends and colleagues spotting him in places he has never been and a mysterious woman claiming a deep connection with him, Pelham is forced to confront the possibility of having a doppelganger or losing his grip on reality. Directed by Michael Relph and produced by Excalibur Films, this suspenseful film delves into the depths of paranoia and self-discovery, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats with a captivating average note of 6.7. With a budget of 0.4 million dollars, the movie went on to generate a staggering revenue of 175.0 million dollars, proving to be a hauntingly successful venture. The tagline "You will live every shattering moment of terror with... The Man Who Haunted Himself" sets the tone for a gripping cinematic experience. 

The cast includes Anton Rodgers, Olga Georges-Picot, and Freddie Jones.

title = Home 
overview = With aerial footage from 54 countries, Home is a depiction of how the Earth's problems are all interlinked. 
Director = Yann Arthus-Bertrand 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Yann Arthus-Bertrand 

In "Home," directed by Yann Arthus-Bertrand, viewers are taken on a visually stunning journey with aerial footage from 54 countries. This documentary beautifully illustrates how the Earth's problems are intricately interconnected, showcasing the delicate balance of our planet's ecosystems. Through breathtaking imagery and compelling storytelling, "Home" serves as a powerful reminder of the importance of environmental conservation and global cooperation. The film provides a comprehensive look at various environmental issues such as deforestation, pollution, and climate change, highlighting the urgent need for sustainable practices to protect our planet for future generations.

['wrong']

The film provides a comprehensive look at various environmental issues such as deforestation, pollution, and climate change, highlighting the urgent need for sustainable practices to protect our planet for future generations.

title = Roman Holiday 
overview = Overwhelmed by her suffocating schedule, touring European princess Ann takes off for a night while in Rome. When a sedative she took from her doctor kicks in, however, she falls asleep on a park bench and is found by an American reporter, Joe Bradley, who takes her back to his apartment for safety. At work the next morning, Joe finds out Ann's regal identity and bets his editor he can get exclusive interview with her, but romance soon gets in the way. 
tagline = Romance in romantic Rome! 
Director = William Wyler 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Romance in romantic Rome! 

In the enchanting film "Roman Holiday," directed by William Wyler, we are transported to the romantic city of Rome. The story follows Princess Ann, a European royal overwhelmed by her demanding schedule, who decides to escape for a night of freedom. After taking a sedative, she falls asleep on a park bench and is discovered by American reporter Joe Bradley. Taking her to his apartment for safety, Joe soon realizes Ann's true identity and sees an opportunity for an exclusive interview. However, as romance blossoms between them, their professional relationship becomes complicated. Set against the backdrop of the picturesque Rome, "Roman Holiday" is a tale of love, adventure, and the magic of unexpected encounters. Don't miss this captivating story of Romance in romantic Rome!

- Overview provided
- Tagline: Romance in romantic Rome!
- Director: William Wyler
- Original language of the movie: English

title = Species 
overview = In 1993, the Search for Extra Terrestrial Intelligence Project receives a transmission detailing an alien DNA structure, along with instructions on how to splice it with human DNA. The result is Sil, a sensual but deadly creature who can change from a beautiful woman to an armour-plated killing machine in the blink of an eye. 
revenue = 113.4 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Roger Donaldson 
Producer = Frank Mancuso Jr. 
tagline = Our time is up. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 113.4 millions of dollars 

In the sci-fi thriller "Species," directed by Roger Donaldson and produced by Frank Mancuso Jr., a groundbreaking experiment merges alien DNA with human DNA, leading to the creation of Sil, a mesmerizing yet lethal being capable of transforming from a seductive woman to a formidable killing entity in an instant. As the Search for Extra Terrestrial Intelligence Project faces the consequences of their actions, they must confront the terrifying reality of a being that threatens humanity's existence. With a revenue of 113.4 million dollars, this English-language film delivers a chilling narrative encapsulated by the tagline, "Our time is up."

title = The Nun's Story 
overview = Gabrielle Van Der Mal gave up everything to become a nun. But her faith and her vows are forever being tested: first in the missionary Congo hospital where she assists the brilliant and handsome Dr. Fortunati and then at the mother house in France when World War II has broken out and the nuns are forbidden by the order to take sides. 
average note = 7.4 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 2h29 
revenue = 12.8 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.4 

In "The Nun's Story," Gabrielle Van Der Mal makes the ultimate sacrifice to become a nun, only to have her faith challenged in unexpected ways. From her work in a missionary hospital in the Congo alongside the charismatic Dr. Fortunati to navigating the complexities of World War II at the mother house in France, Gabrielle's convictions are tested at every turn. This American production, with a runtime of 2 hours and 29 minutes, delves into themes of faith, duty, and moral dilemmas. Despite its revenue of 12.8 million dollars, the heart of the story remains Gabrielle's unwavering commitment to her beliefs. The movie received an average note of 7.4 and was originally filmed in English. The production country for "The Nun's Story" is the United States of America.

Despite its revenue of 12.8 million dollars, the heart of the story remains Gabrielle's unwavering commitment to her beliefs. The movie received an average note of 7.4 and was originally filmed in English. The production country for "The Nun's Story" is the United States of America.

title = Scaramouche 
overview = In 18th-century France, a young man masquerades as an actor to avenge his friend's murder. 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
cast = Stewart Granger, Eleanor Parker, Janet Leigh, Mel Ferrer 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 6.7 millions of dollars 
Director = George Sidney 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h55 

In the swashbuckling adventure film "Scaramouche," set in 18th-century France, a young man takes on the guise of an actor to seek vengeance for his friend's untimely death. Directed by George Sidney, the movie boasts a stellar cast including Stewart Granger, Eleanor Parker, Janet Leigh, and Mel Ferrer. With a runtime of 1 hour and 55 minutes, the film unfolds in English, capturing the essence of the era with its captivating storyline. Made with a budget of 3.0 million dollars, "Scaramouche" went on to earn a revenue of 6.7 million dollars, proving to be a successful venture both critically and commercially.
