title = Banshee Chapter 
overview = On the trail of a missing friend who had been experimenting with mind-altering drugs, a young journalist - aided by a rogue counter-culture writer, The Silence of The Lambs -- finds herself drawn into the dangerous world of top-secret government chemical research and the mystery of a disturbing radio signal of unknown origin. A fast-paced thriller blending fact and fiction, Banshee Chapter is based on real documents, actual test subject testimony, and uncovered secrets about covert programs run by the CIA. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Corey Moosa 
Director = Blair Erickson 
tagline = The experiments are over, the terror has just begun... 
production compagnie = Before the Door Pictures 
cast = Ted Levine, Katia Winter, Michael McMillian, Monique Candelaria 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h27 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Banshee Chapter," a young journalist embarks on a search for her missing friend who was experimenting with mind-altering drugs. Teaming up with a rogue counter-culture writer, she delves into the world of top-secret government chemical research and a mysterious radio signal of unknown origin. As the thrilling story unfolds, blending fact and fiction, viewers are taken on a fast-paced journey based on real documents and actual test subject testimony, revealing uncovered secrets about CIA covert programs. Directed by Blair Erickson and produced by Corey Moosa, this American production by Before the Door Pictures features a talented cast including Ted Levine, Katia Winter, Michael McMillian, and Monique Candelaria. With a tagline that promises "The experiments are over, the terror has just begun...," this English-language film runs for a duration of 1 hour and 27 minutes. The production country is the United States of America.

Directed by Blair Erickson and produced by Corey Moosa, this American production by Before the Door Pictures features a talented cast including Ted Levine, Katia Winter, Michael McMillian, and Monique Candelaria. With a tagline that promises "The experiments are over, the terror has just begun...," this English-language film runs for a duration of 1 hour and 27 minutes. The production country is the United States of America.

title = Grimsby 
overview = Wrongfully accused and on the run, a top MI6 assassin joins forces with his long-lost, football hooligan brother to save the world from a sinister plot. 
Producer = Sacha Baron Cohen 
average note = 5.7 
tagline = Behind every hero is an embarrassing sibling 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
budget = 35.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Louis Leterrier 
revenue = 25.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 24 of February 2016 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Sacha Baron Cohen 

In "Grimsby," a high-stakes action-comedy film produced by Sacha Baron Cohen, audiences are taken on a wild ride as a wrongly accused MI6 assassin teams up with his estranged football hooligan brother to thwart a diabolical scheme and save the world. Directed by Louis Leterrier, the movie unfolds over a thrilling 1 hour and 23 minutes, filled with unexpected twists and hilarious moments. With an average note of 5.7, "Grimsby" delivers a unique blend of espionage and humor, showcasing that behind every hero lies an embarrassing sibling. Despite a budget of 35.0 million dollars, the film grossed 25.2 million dollars at the box office upon its release on the 24th of February 2016.

title = The Transporter 
overview = Former Special Forces officer, Frank Martin will deliver anything to anyone for the right price, and his no-questions-asked policy puts him in high demand. But when he realizes his latest cargo is alive, it sets in motion a dangerous chain of events. The bound and gagged Lai is being smuggled to France by a shady American businessman, and Frank works to save her as his own illegal activities are uncovered by a French detective. 
Director = Louis Leterrier 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 43.9 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.6 
budget = 21.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jason Statham, Shu Qi, François Berléand, Matt Schulze 
tagline = Rules are made to be broken. 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 2 of October 2002 
Producer = Luc Besson 
production compagnie = TF1 Films Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Louis Leterrier 

In "The Transporter," directed by Louis Leterrier, former Special Forces officer Frank Martin, portrayed by Jason Statham, operates by a strict no-questions-asked policy when it comes to delivering packages for the right price. However, things take a dangerous turn when he discovers that his latest cargo, the bound and gagged Lai played by Shu Qi, is actually alive. As Frank works to save her from being smuggled to France by a shady American businessman, his own illegal activities come under scrutiny by a French detective, portrayed by François Berléand. With a tagline that states "Rules are made to be broken," this action-packed film was released on the 2nd of October 2002 in the United States of America. The movie, with a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, received an average rating of 6.6 and grossed $43.9 million at the box office against a budget of $21.0 million. The production company behind this thrilling ride is TF1 Films Productions, with Luc Besson serving as the producer. The original language of the movie is English, and the cast also includes Matt Schulze.

title = Evan Almighty 
overview = God contacts Congressman Evan Baxter and tells him to build an ark in preparation for a great flood. 
tagline = A comedy of biblical proportions 
Producer = Tom Shadyac 
revenue = 173.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 175.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Steve Carell, Lauren Graham, John Goodman, Jimmy Bennett 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 
average note = 5.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = A comedy of biblical proportions 

In "Evan Almighty," produced by Tom Shadyac and released by Columbia Pictures, Congressman Evan Baxter, played by Steve Carell, receives a divine directive from God to construct an ark in anticipation of a massive flood. With a star-studded cast including Lauren Graham, John Goodman, and Jimmy Bennett, this comedy of biblical proportions grossed an impressive $173.0 million at the box office. Despite its $175.0 million budget, the film managed to entertain audiences with its unique take on a classic tale. With an average rating of 5.3, "Evan Almighty" delivers a humorous and heartwarming story of faith, family, and the unexpected challenges of following a higher calling. The tagline for the film is "A comedy of biblical proportions."

With an average rating of 5.3, "Evan Almighty" delivers a humorous and heartwarming story of faith, family, and the unexpected challenges of following a higher calling. The tagline for the film is "A comedy of biblical proportions."

title = C.H.U.D. 
overview = A rash of bizarre murders in New York City seems to point to a group of grotesquely deformed vagrants living in the sewers. A courageous policeman, a photo journalist and his girlfriend, and a nutty bum, who seems to know a lot about the creatures, band together to try and determine what the creatures are and how to stop them. 
Director = Douglas Cheek 
average note = 5.3 
Producer = Andrew Bonime 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 31 of August 1984 
tagline = They're not staying down there anymore! 
production compagnie = New World Pictures 
revenue = 3.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
budget = 1.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Douglas Cheek 

In the 1984 horror film "C.H.U.D.", a series of strange murders in New York City leads to the discovery of grotesquely deformed vagrants living in the sewers. As the city is terrorized by these mysterious creatures, a brave policeman, a determined photojournalist, and his girlfriend, along with a peculiar homeless man who holds crucial information about the monsters, band together to uncover the truth behind the attacks and find a way to defeat them. Directed by Douglas Cheek and produced by Andrew Bonime, this English-language movie was released on August 31st, 1984, under the production company New World Pictures. With a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, "C.H.U.D." had a budget of 1.2 million dollars and grossed 3.4 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "They're not staying down there anymore!" perfectly captures the escalating tension and horror as the characters confront the terrifying creatures lurking beneath the city streets.

title = Aladdin 
overview = Princess Jasmine grows tired of being forced to remain in the palace and she sneaks out into the marketplace  in disguise where she meets street-urchin Aladdin and the two fall in love, although she may only marry a prince. After being thrown in jail, Aladdin and becomes embroiled in a plot to find a mysterious lamp with which the evil Jafar hopes to rule the land. 
budget = 28.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 28.0 millions of dollars 

In the magical land of Agrabah, Princess Jasmine longs for freedom from her royal constraints and finds solace in the bustling marketplace where she meets the charming street-urchin, Aladdin. As their forbidden love blossoms, Aladdin's life takes a thrilling turn when he stumbles upon a mysterious lamp coveted by the sinister Jafar, who seeks to wield its power to rule the kingdom. With a budget of 28 million dollars, this enchanting tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences for 1 hour and 30 minutes. "Aladdin" is a dazzling adventure set in the United States of America, where love, courage, and magic intertwine in a timeless story of destiny and dreams.

title = 3 A.M. 
overview = The feature film directing debut of Spike Lee protege Lee Davis takes the viewer into the world of taxi drivers. Developed in the Sundance Laboratory, this film offers dove-tailing stories centering on the lives of individual taxi drivers as they reflect on and experience romance, politics, sociology, and spirituality. 
average note = 5.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.0 

In the captivating movie "3 A.M.," viewers are taken on a journey into the bustling world of taxi drivers. With its roots in the Sundance Laboratory, this film showcases intertwining narratives that delve into the personal lives of various taxi drivers. From exploring themes of romance and politics to delving into sociology and spirituality, each character's story offers a unique perspective on life. Directed by Spike Lee protege Lee Davis, this feature film debut is a compelling exploration of human experiences behind the wheel. Developed in the Sundance Laboratory, this film offers dove-tailing stories centering on the lives of individual taxi drivers as they reflect on and experience romance, politics, sociology, and spirituality. With an average rating of 5.0, "3 A.M." promises to immerse audiences in a thought-provoking and engaging cinematic experience.

['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h28

With an average rating of 5.0, "3 A.M." promises to immerse audiences in a thought-provoking and engaging cinematic experience.

title = Le Trou 
overview = An imprisoned man, awaiting trial for the attempted murder of his wife, is transferred to another cell, where his fellow prisoners are planning a jailbreak. He decides to go along with the elaborate plan, and the cellmates attempt to tunnel their way to freedom. Le Trou represents the last film of director Jacques Becker, who died shortly after its completion. 
budget = 26.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 26.6 millions of dollars 

In the gripping film "Le Trou," a man finds himself in prison, accused of attempting to murder his wife. As he is moved to a new cell, he discovers that his fellow inmates are plotting a daring escape. Intrigued by the elaborate plan, he joins forces with them as they embark on tunneling their way to freedom. Directed by the talented Jacques Becker, "Le Trou" serves as his final cinematic masterpiece before his untimely passing. With a budget of 26.6 million dollars, this intense drama showcases the resilience and camaraderie of those fighting for their liberty behind bars. Le Trou represents the last film of director Jacques Becker, who died shortly after its completion.

overview = Iris invites her friend Jack to stay at her family's island getaway after the death of his brother. At their remote cabin, Jack's drunken encounter with Hannah, Iris' sister, kicks off a revealing stretch of days.

production countrie = United States of America

In the American film "Your Sister's Sister," Iris extends a heartfelt invitation to her friend Jack to seek solace at her family's secluded island retreat following the tragic loss of his brother. Amidst the serene backdrop of their remote cabin, Jack's inebriated rendezvous with Hannah, Iris' sister, sets in motion a series of emotionally charged and enlightening days. Starring Mark Duplass, Emily Blunt, Rosemarie DeWitt, and Mike Birbiglia, this English-language production unfolds against the picturesque landscapes of the United States of America.

title = Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man 
overview = It's the lawless future, and renegade biker Harley Davidson (Mickey Rourke) and his surly cowboy buddy, Marlboro (Don Johnson), learn that a corrupt bank is about to foreclose on their friend's bar to further an expanding empire. Harley and Marlboro decide to help by robbing the crooked bank. But when they accidentally filch a drug shipment, they find themselves on the run from criminal financiers and the mob in this rugged action adventure. 
date of release = the 23 of August 1991 
budget = 23.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 23 of August 1991 

In the lawless future, Harley Davidson, a renegade biker, and his cowboy buddy, Marlboro, discover a corrupt bank's plan to foreclose on their friend's bar. Determined to help, they embark on a risky mission to rob the bank. However, their heist takes an unexpected turn when they unintentionally steal a drug shipment, leading them to become targets of criminal financiers and the mob. Released on the 23rd of August 1991 with a budget of 23.0 million dollars, "Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man" is a rugged action adventure that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

overview = A Chicago mobster hires a rock and roll singer and his band to keep an eye on his daughter during Spring Break in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

title = 1408 
overview = A man who specializes in debunking paranormal occurrences checks into the fabled room 1408 in the Dolphin Hotel. Soon after settling in, he confronts genuine terror. 
revenue = 94.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Mikael Håfström 
date of release = the 12 of July 2007 
cast = John Cusack, Samuel L. Jackson, Mary McCormack, Jasmine Jessica Anthony 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 94.7 millions of dollars 

In the psychological horror film "1408," directed by Mikael Håfström, a skeptic of paranormal activities, portrayed by John Cusack, decides to spend a night in the infamous room 1408 at the Dolphin Hotel. Despite his initial disbelief, he is soon faced with terrifying and unexplainable events that challenge his rationality. Alongside a stellar cast including Samuel L. Jackson, Mary McCormack, and Jasmine Jessica Anthony, the movie was released on the 12th of July 2007, grossing an impressive $94.7 million at the box office.

title = Blue Summer 
overview = A couple of dudes pack a van full of beer and go on a road trip in search of sexual adventures. They get that and more. 
average note = 4.7 
tagline = Young bodies on the prowl... they pay by the mile! 
cast = Davey Jones, Bo White, Lilly Bi Peep, Joann Sterling 
revenue = 144.5 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 20 of November 1973 
budget = 65.7 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h19 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Allan Shackleton 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 4.7 

In the 1973 film "Blue Summer," produced by Allan Shackleton, a group of young men embarks on a wild road trip in a van filled with beer, seeking out sexual escapades along the way. As they journey through the United States of America, their adventures take unexpected turns, leading to encounters that exceed their initial expectations. Starring Davey Jones, Bo White, Lilly Bi Peep, and Joann Sterling, this provocative film explores the desires and experiences of its characters against a backdrop of freedom and exploration. With a tagline that reads "Young bodies on the prowl... they pay by the mile!" and a notable average rating of 4.7, "Blue Summer" captivates audiences with its daring narrative and uninhibited spirit. Despite its budget of 65.7 million dollars, the film went on to gross an impressive 144.5 million dollars at the box office, solidifying its place in cinematic history. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 19 minutes and was released on the 20th of November 1973. The original language of the movie is English.

title = The Black Dahlia 
overview = Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers-turned-cops in 1940s Los Angeles and, when an aspiring young actress turns up dead, Blanchard and Bleichert must grapple with corruption, narcissism, stag films and family madness as they pursue the killer. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Inspired by the most notorious unsolved murder in California history. 

title = The Black Dahlia 
overview = Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers-turned-cops in 1940s Los Angeles and, when an aspiring young actress turns up dead, Blanchard and Bleichert must grapple with corruption, narcissism, stag films and family madness as they pursue the killer. 

In the gritty streets of 1940s Los Angeles, former boxers-turned-cops Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert find themselves entangled in a web of corruption and deceit. When the body of a young aspiring actress, known as the Black Dahlia, is discovered, the two detectives are thrust into a world of narcissism, stag films, and family madness as they race to catch the elusive killer. As Blanchard and Bleichert navigate the dark underbelly of Hollywood, they must confront their own demons and unravel the twisted secrets that threaten to consume them. Will they be able to solve the mystery of The Black Dahlia before it's too late? 

facts:
1. The story is set in 1940s Los Angeles.
2. Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers who become police officers.
3. The plot involves the murder of an aspiring young actress known as the Black Dahlia.
4. Corruption, narcissism, stag films, and family madness are central themes in the story.

['wrong']

In the gritty streets of 1940s Los Angeles, former boxers-turned-cops Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert find themselves entangled in a web of corruption and deceit. When the body of a young aspiring actress, known as the Black Dahlia, is discovered, the two detectives are thrust into a world of narcissism, stag films, and family madness as they race to catch the elusive killer. As Blanchard and Bleichert navigate the dark underbelly of Hollywood, they must confront their own demons and unravel the twisted secrets that threaten to consume them. 2. Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers who become police officers.
3. The plot involves the murder of an aspiring young actress known as the Black Dahlia.
4. Corruption, narcissism, stag films, and family madness are central themes in the story.

['correct']
fact : cast = Josh Hartnett, Scarlett Johansson, Aaron Eckhart, Hilary Swank 

title = The Black Dahlia 
overview = Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers-turned-cops in 1940s Los Angeles and, when an aspiring young actress turns up dead, Blanchard and Bleichert must grapple with corruption, narcissism, stag films and family madness as they pursue the killer. 

In the gritty streets of 1940s Los Angeles, former boxers-turned-cops Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert find themselves entangled in a web of corruption and deceit. When the body of a young aspiring actress, known as the Black Dahlia, is discovered, the two detectives are thrust into a world of narcissism, stag films, and family madness as they race to catch the elusive killer. As Blanchard and Bleichert navigate the dark underbelly of Hollywood, they must confront their own demons and unravel the twisted secrets that threaten to consume them. Will they be able to solve the mystery of The Black Dahlia before it's too late? 

facts:
1. The story is set in 1940s Los Angeles.
2. Lee Blanchard and Bucky Bleichert are former boxers who become police officers.
3. The plot involves the murder of an aspiring young actress known as the Black Dahlia.
4. Corruption, narcissism, stag films, and family madness are central themes in the story.

title = Tap Roots 
overview = Set at the beginning of the Civil War, Tap Roots is all about a county in Mississippi which chooses to secede from the state rather than enter the conflict. The county is protected from the Confederacy by an abolitionist (Ward Bond) and a Native American gentleman (Boris Karloff). The abolitionist's daughter (Susan Hayward) is courted by a powerful newspaper publisher (Van Heflin) when her fiance (Whitfield Connor), a confederate officer, elopes with the girl's sister (Julie London). The daughter at first resists the publisher's attentions, but turns to him for aid when her ex-fiance plans to capture the seceding county on behalf of the South. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Walter Wanger 
date of release = the 25 of August 1948 
tagline = When she lost her lover...her sister gained one! 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 244.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Van Heflin, Susan Hayward, Boris Karloff, Julie London 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
budget = 4.8 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Walter Wanger Productions 
average note = 6.3 
Director = George Marshall 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1948 American film "Tap Roots," set at the onset of the Civil War, a county in Mississippi makes a bold decision to secede from the state to avoid being drawn into the conflict. The county finds protection from the Confederacy through the efforts of an abolitionist and a Native American gentleman. The story unfolds as the abolitionist's daughter, portrayed by Susan Hayward, navigates romantic entanglements involving a powerful newspaper publisher, played by Van Heflin, and her Confederate officer ex-fiance. As tensions rise and alliances shift, the daughter must seek the publisher's help to thwart her ex-fiance's plans to capture the seceding county. Directed by George Marshall and produced by Walter Wanger, "Tap Roots" features a stellar cast including Boris Karloff and Julie London. With a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, this historical drama captivates audiences with its tale of love, loyalty, and defiance. Don't miss the gripping narrative that unfolds against the backdrop of a divided nation.

The movie was released on the 25th of August 1948 in the United States of America. The tagline for the film is "When she lost her lover...her sister gained one!" The original language of the movie is English. The film had a budget of 4.8 million dollars and generated a revenue of 244.0 million dollars. The production company behind "Tap Roots" is Walter Wanger Productions. The average rating for the movie is 6.3.

title = Valentino 
overview = In 1926 the tragic and untimely death of a silent screen actor caused female moviegoers to riot in the streets and in some cases to commit suicide... 
cast = Rudolf Nureyev, Leslie Caron, Michelle Phillips, Carol Kane 
average note = 5.4 
Producer = Irwin Winkler 
production compagnie = United Artists 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = In life he was a movie star, in death he became a legend. 
revenue = 98.8 millions of dollars 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Rudolf Nureyev, Leslie Caron, Michelle Phillips, Carol Kane 

In "Valentino," a film produced by Irwin Winkler under United Artists, audiences are transported back to 1926 when the tragic death of a silent screen actor led to unprecedented chaos, with female moviegoers rioting and even resorting to extreme measures like suicide. Starring Rudolf Nureyev, Leslie Caron, Michelle Phillips, and Carol Kane, this movie delves into the life and legacy of the iconic actor. With a tagline that reads "In life he was a movie star, in death he became a legend," "Valentino" captures the essence of a man who captivated hearts both on and off the screen. Despite its modest budget of 5.0 million dollars, the film went on to generate a remarkable revenue of 98.8 million dollars, proving to be a success with an average rating of 5.4. The production company behind "Valentino" is United Artists, and the film was produced in the United Kingdom. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.4

In "Valentino," a film produced by Irwin Winkler under United Artists, audiences are transported back to 1926 when the tragic death of a silent screen actor led to unprecedented chaos, with female moviegoers rioting and even resorting to extreme measures like suicide. Starring Rudolf Nureyev, Leslie Caron, Michelle Phillips, and Carol Kane, this movie delves into the life and legacy of the iconic actor. With a tagline that reads "In life he was a movie star, in death he became a legend," "Valentino" captures the essence of a man who captivated hearts both on and off the screen. Despite its modest budget of 5.0 million dollars, the film went on to generate a remarkable revenue of 98.8 million dollars, proving to be a success with an average rating of 5.4. The production company behind "Valentino" is United Artists, and the film was produced in the United Kingdom.

title = The Karate Kid, Part II 
overview = Mr. Miyagi and Daniel take a trip to Okinawa to visit Mr. Miyagi's dying father. After arriving Mr. Miyagi finds he still has feelings for an old love. This stirs up trouble with an old rival who he originally left Okinawa to avoid. In the mean time, Daniel encounters a new love and also makes some enemies. 
cast = Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita, Martin Kove, Charlie Tanimoto 
date of release = the 18 of June 1986 
Producer = Jerry Weintraub 
tagline = This time, the combat is real. 
budget = 0.0 millions of dollars 
Director = John G. Avildsen 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
revenue = 115.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.9 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita, Martin Kove, Charlie Tanimoto 

In "The Karate Kid, Part II," Mr. Miyagi and Daniel embark on a journey to Okinawa to visit Mr. Miyagi's ailing father. While there, old flames are rekindled as Mr. Miyagi discovers lingering feelings for a past love, leading to a confrontation with a long-standing rival he had once fled from. As Daniel navigates a new romance, he also finds himself facing adversaries. Directed by John G. Avildsen and produced by Jerry Weintraub, this sequel to the beloved original film features a stellar cast including Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita, Martin Kove, and Charlie Tanimoto. Released on June 18, 1986, in the United States by Columbia Pictures Corporation, "The Karate Kid, Part II" grossed $115.1 million at the box office, with an average rating of 5.9. With the tagline "This time, the combat is real," this English-language film continues the iconic story of mentorship, love, and martial arts.

duration of the movie = 1h44

fact : production compagnie = Intrepid Pictures 

In the supernatural horror film "Oculus," directed by Mike Flanagan and released on the 8th of September 2013, a woman takes on the daunting task of clearing her brother's name from a murder conviction. She believes that the true culprit behind the crime is a malevolent supernatural force. Produced by Intrepid Pictures in the United States of America and with an average rating of 6.3, this English-language movie runs for 1 hour and 44 minutes. With a budget of 5.0 million dollars, "Oculus" will make you question reality as the tagline suggests, "You see what it wants you to see."

title = Acolytes 
overview = Three teens blackmail a serial killer into helping them get rid of a violent bully. 
production compagnie = Stewart and Wall Entertainment 
production countrie = Australia 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Jon Hewitt 
tagline = Nothing stays buried forever. 
cast = Joel Edgerton, Michael Dorman, Sebastian Gregory, Hanna Mangan Lawrence 
date of release = the 20 of September 2008 
budget = 226.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h31 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Stewart and Wall Entertainment 

In the Australian thriller "Acolytes," directed by Jon Hewitt and released on the 20th of September 2008, three teens find themselves in a dangerous game of manipulation. After discovering a serial killer in their midst, they blackmail him into helping them take down a violent bully. With a budget of 226.8 million dollars, the film, produced by Stewart and Wall Entertainment in Australia, features a talented cast including Joel Edgerton, Michael Dorman, Sebastian Gregory, and Hanna Mangan Lawrence. As secrets unravel and tensions rise, the tagline "Nothing stays buried forever" proves to be chillingly accurate in this 1 hour and 31-minute English-language thriller.

['correct']

title = The Curse of the Jade Scorpion 
overview = CW Briggs is a veteran insurance investigator, with many successes. Betty Ann Fitzgerald is a new employee in the company he works for, with the task of reorganizing the office. They don't like each other - or at least that's what they think. During a night out with the rest of the office employees, they go to watch Voltan, a magician who secretly hypnotizes both of them. 
Producer = Letty Aronson 
cast = Dan Aykroyd, Helen Hunt, Woody Allen, Charlize Theron 
budget = 213.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Letty Aronson 

In "The Curse of the Jade Scorpion," veteran insurance investigator CW Briggs, portrayed by Dan Aykroyd, finds himself at odds with new employee Betty Ann Fitzgerald, played by Helen Hunt. As they navigate their rocky relationship while working together to reorganize the office, a fateful night out to watch magician Voltan, portrayed by Woody Allen, takes a bizarre turn. Under Voltan's secret hypnosis, their animosity towards each other takes a mysterious and unexpected twist. With a stellar cast including Charlize Theron, this intriguing tale, produced by Letty Aronson, unfolds against a budget of 213.8 million dollars, promising a blend of comedy, mystery, and suspense. The movie is titled "The Curse of the Jade Scorpion."

title = Whatever It Takes 
overview = A nerdy teen, Ryan Woodman is smitten with the popular and gorgeous Ashley Grant, who apparently has no interest in him. Meanwhile, dim star athlete Chris Campbell has his eye on Ryan's brainy and beautiful friend, Maggie Carter. The two agree to help each other in their romantic quests, but, as they come closer to their goals, both Ryan and Chris suspect that they might be pursuing the wrong girls. 
average note = 5.1 
revenue = 9.9 millions of dollars 
cast = Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Shane West, Marla Sokoloff, James Franco 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 31 of March 2000 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = David Raynr 
duration of the movie = 1h34 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.1 

In the romantic comedy "Whatever It Takes," nerdy teen Ryan Woodman finds himself infatuated with the popular and stunning Ashley Grant, who doesn't seem to reciprocate his feelings. At the same time, star athlete Chris Campbell sets his sights on Ryan's intelligent and lovely friend, Maggie Carter. In a twist of fate, Ryan and Chris strike a deal to assist each other in their pursuit of love, but as they edge closer to their objectives, they begin to question if they are chasing after the right girls. Directed by David Raynr and released on the 31st of March 2000 in the United States of America by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this film features a talented cast including Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Shane West, Marla Sokoloff, and James Franco. With an average rating of 5.1 and a box office revenue of 9.9 million dollars, this English-language movie runs for 1 hour and 34 minutes, offering a humorous and heartwarming take on teenage romance.

title = Black Sheep 
overview = A genetic engineering experiment gone horribly awry turns a large flock of docile sheep into unrelenting killing machines in this rural horror comedy directed by Jonathan King and featuring special effects designed by Weta Workshop. 
average note = 5.7 
production compagnie = New Zealand Film Commission 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
production countrie = New Zealand 
Director = Jonathan King 
tagline = There are over 40 million sheep in New Zealand, and they're pissed off! 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 9 of September 2006 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.7 

In the rural horror comedy "Black Sheep," directed by Jonathan King and featuring special effects by Weta Workshop, a genetic engineering experiment in New Zealand goes terribly wrong, transforming a peaceful flock of sheep into bloodthirsty killers. With an average rating of 5.7, this 1 hour and 27-minute film from the New Zealand Film Commission is a wild ride filled with mayhem and dark humor. Released on the 9th of September 2006, the movie's tagline warns: "There are over 40 million sheep in New Zealand, and they're pissed off!" Presented in English, "Black Sheep" is a unique and thrilling take on the horror genre. The production company behind the movie is the New Zealand Film Commission, and the production country is New Zealand.

The production company behind the movie is the New Zealand Film Commission, and the production country is New Zealand.

title = Macbeth 
overview = Feature film adaptation of Shakespeare's Scottish play about General Macbeth whose ambitious wife urges him to use wicked means in order to gain power of the throne over the sitting king, Duncan. 
revenue = 12.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Paddy Considine, Sean Harris 
production compagnie = Studio Canal 
date of release = the 16 of August 2015 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Iain Canning 
production countrie = France 
Director = Justin Kurzel 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 12.6 millions of dollars 

In 2015, "Macbeth" was released, a visually stunning feature film adaptation of Shakespeare's Scottish play. Directed by Justin Kurzel and produced by Iain Canning, the movie follows General Macbeth, portrayed by Michael Fassbender, as he is urged by his ambitious wife, played by Marion Cotillard, to use wicked means to seize the throne from King Duncan. The stellar cast also includes Paddy Considine and Sean Harris. With a budget of 15.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross 12.6 million dollars in revenue. "Macbeth" was produced by Studio Canal in France and is presented in its original language, English.

"Macbeth" was produced by Studio Canal in France and is presented in its original language, English.

title = Skinwalker Ranch 
overview = In  2010 “Skinwalker Ranch” gained media attention after experiencing a wide range of unexplained phenomena. Reports ranged from UFO sightings to livestock mutilation, but maybe most notable was the disappearance of ranch owner Hoyt Miller’s eight-year-old son Cody on November 11, 2010. Close to a year later, Modern Defense Enterprises has sent a team of experts to document and investigate the mysterious occurrences, which only escalate upon their arrival. Tensions rise as the team must decide how far they will go to unlock the mysteries of “Skinwalker Ranch.” The group debates whether the answers are worth risking their lives for, or if they should just call off the investigation and leave the ranch—that is, if leaving is actually an option… 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the mysterious and eerie setting of "Skinwalker Ranch," a team of experts from Modern Defense Enterprises embarks on a perilous journey to uncover the truth behind a series of unexplained phenomena that have plagued the area since 2010. From UFO sightings to livestock mutilation, the ranch has become a hotbed of strange occurrences, culminating in the chilling disappearance of ranch owner Hoyt Miller's young son, Cody, on November 11, 2010. Close to a year later, Modern Defense Enterprises has sent a team of experts to document and investigate the mysterious occurrences, which only escalate upon their arrival. As the team delves deeper into the mysteries surrounding the ranch, tensions run high and the stakes become increasingly dire. With each passing day, the line between curiosity and danger blurs, forcing the team to confront the ultimate question: are they willing to risk everything, including their own lives, in order to unlock the dark secrets of Skinwalker Ranch? The group debates whether the answers are worth risking their lives for, or if they should just call off the investigation and leave the ranch—that is, if leaving is actually an option.

title = John Tucker Must Die 
overview = After discovering they are all dating the same same guy, three popular students from different cliques band together for revenge, so they enlist the help of a new gal in town and conspire to break the jerk's heart, while destroying his reputation. 
cast = Jesse Metcalfe, Brittany Snow, Ashanti, Sophia Bush 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Jesse Metcalfe, Brittany Snow, Ashanti, Sophia Bush 

In "John Tucker Must Die," a group of high school students from different social circles unite in a mission of revenge after realizing they are all dating the same guy. Jesse Metcalfe, Brittany Snow, Ashanti, and Sophia Bush star in this comedy where they enlist the help of a new girl in town to break John Tucker's heart and ruin his reputation. As the plan unfolds, the girls navigate through love, friendship, and teenage drama, all while seeking justice for being wronged by the charming but deceitful John Tucker.

Jesse Metcalfe, Brittany Snow, Ashanti, and Sophia Bush star in this comedy where they enlist the help of a new girl in town to break John Tucker's heart and ruin his reputation. As the plan unfolds, the girls navigate through love, friendship, and teenage drama, all while seeking justice for being wronged by the charming but deceitful John Tucker.

title = Hair 
overview = "Hair" is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical "Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical" about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center.
 Claude heads to New York upon receiving his draft notice, leaving the family ranch in Oklahoma. He arrives in New York where he is rapidly indoctrinated into the youth subculture before reporting in for boot camp. 
cast = John Savage, Treat Williams, Annie Golden, Beverly D'Angelo 
production compagnie = United Artists 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = John Savage, Treat Williams, Annie Golden, Beverly D'Angelo 

In the 1979 musical war comedy-drama film "Hair," based on the 1968 Broadway musical "Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical," we follow Claude, a Vietnam War draftee who embarks on a journey to the army induction center. Along the way, he encounters a tribe of long-haired hippies who quickly become his friends. Leaving behind his family ranch in Oklahoma, Claude heads to New York where he immerses himself in the vibrant youth subculture before facing boot camp. Starring John Savage, Treat Williams, Annie Golden, and Beverly D'Angelo, this film captures the essence of a generation in turmoil. Produced by United Artists, "Hair" is a timeless exploration of love, friendship, and the impact of war on young lives. The film is a musical that features songs like "Aquarius" and "Let the Sunshine In."

title = Evolution 
overview = A comedy that follows the chaos that ensues when a meteor hits the Earth carrying alien life forms that give new meaning to the term "survival of the fittest." David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Seann William Scott, and Julianne Moore are the only people standing between the aliens and world domination... which could be bad news for the Earth. 
Director = Ivan Reitman 
production compagnie = DreamWorks SKG 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Ivan Reitman 

In "Evolution," directed by Ivan Reitman and produced by DreamWorks SKG, chaos erupts when a meteor crashes into Earth, bringing with it alien life forms that redefine the concept of "survival of the fittest." David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Seann William Scott, and Julianne Moore find themselves in a race against time to prevent the aliens from achieving world domination. As they navigate through the comedic mayhem, they must use their wit and courage to save the planet from impending doom. This English-language film is a thrilling blend of humor, action, and science fiction that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. The movie "Evolution" is a comedy that follows the chaos that ensues when a meteor hits the Earth carrying alien life forms that give new meaning to the term "survival of the fittest."

title = 4 Little Girls 
overview = On September 15, 1963, a bomb destroyed a black church in Birmingham, Alabama, killing four young girls who were there for Sunday school. It was a crime that shocked the nation--and a defining moment in the history of the civil-rights movement. Spike Lee re-examines the full story of the bombing, including a revealing interview with former Alabama Governor George Wallace. 
average note = 6.7 
production compagnie = 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks 
cast = Maxine McNair, Chris McNair, Helen Pegues, Queen Nunn 
Director = Spike Lee 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.7 

In "4 Little Girls," director Spike Lee delves into the tragic events of September 15, 1963, when a bomb ripped through a black church in Birmingham, Alabama, claiming the lives of four young girls attending Sunday school. This heinous act not only shocked the nation but also became a pivotal moment in the civil-rights movement. Through powerful storytelling and a poignant interview with former Alabama Governor George Wallace, Lee uncovers the full story behind the bombing. The film features a stellar cast including Maxine McNair, Chris McNair, Helen Pegues, and Queen Nunn, who bring depth and emotion to this heartbreaking tale. With an average rating of 6.7, "4 Little Girls" is a compelling and important exploration of a dark chapter in American history. Produced by 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks, this film is a must-watch for those seeking to understand the impact of racial violence on society. 

Facts included:
- Title: 4 Little Girls
- Overview of the film
- Average rating: 6.7
- Production company: 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks
- Cast: Maxine McNair, Chris McNair, Helen Pegues, Queen Nunn
- Director: Spike Lee

In "4 Little Girls," director Spike Lee delves into the tragic events of September 15, 1963, when a bomb ripped through a black church in Birmingham, Alabama, claiming the lives of four young girls attending Sunday school. This heinous act not only shocked the nation but also became a pivotal moment in the civil-rights movement. Through powerful storytelling and a poignant interview with former Alabama Governor George Wallace, Lee uncovers the full story behind the bombing. The film features a stellar cast including Maxine McNair, Chris McNair, Helen Pegues, and Queen Nunn, who bring depth and emotion to this heartbreaking tale. With an average rating of 6.7, "4 Little Girls" is a compelling and important exploration of a dark chapter in American history. Produced by 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks, this film is a must-watch for those seeking to understand the impact of racial violence on society. 

Facts included:
- Title: 4 Little Girls
- Overview of the film
- Average rating: 6.7
- Production company: 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks
- Cast: Maxine McNair, Chris McNair, Helen Pegues, Queen Nunn
- Director: Spike Lee

title = In the Name of the Father 
overview = A small time thief from Belfast, Gerry Conlon, is falsely implicated in the IRA bombing of a pub that kills several people while he is in London. He and his four friends are coerced by British police into confessing their guilt. Gerry's father and other relatives in London are also implicated in the crime. He spends fifteen years in prison with his father trying to prove his innocence. 
cast = Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Emma Thompson, John Lynch 
Producer = Jim Sheridan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Emma Thompson, John Lynch 

In the gripping drama "In the Name of the Father," directed by Jim Sheridan and produced by Jim Sheridan, we follow the harrowing journey of Gerry Conlon, brilliantly portrayed by Daniel Day-Lewis. Falsely accused of an IRA bombing in London, Gerry and his friends, including the talented John Lynch, are coerced into confessing by British police. As Gerry's father, played by the remarkable Pete Postlethwaite, fights alongside him to prove their innocence, the stellar Emma Thompson shines as a key figure in their legal battle. This intense tale of injustice and family loyalty unfolds over fifteen years, showcasing the resilience and strength of the human spirit in the face of adversity.

Cast: Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Emma Thompson, John Lynch
Producer: Jim Sheridan

title = Young Doctors in Love 
overview = An "Airplane!"-style spoof of hospital soap operas: a brilliant young trainee can't stand the sight of blood; a doctor romances the head nurse in order to get the key to the drugs cabinet; there's a mafioso on the loose disguised as a woman - in other words all the usual ingredients present and correct, though in this case the laughs are intentional. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Warning: This Movie May Be Dangerous To Your Health. You May Never Stop Laughing. 
date of release = the 16 of July 1982 
average note = 5.2 
budget = 283.9 millions of dollars 
cast = Michael McKean, Sean Young, Héctor Elizondo, Harry Dean Stanton 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the hilarious comedy "Young Doctors in Love," produced by Jerry Bruckheimer, viewers are taken on a wild ride through the chaotic world of a hospital. Set in the United States of America, this "Airplane!"-style spoof of hospital soap operas follows a group of eccentric characters including a brilliant but blood-averse young trainee, a doctor using romance to access the drugs cabinet, and a mafioso disguised as a woman. As the plot unfolds, the laughs are intentional and non-stop, making it a dangerous movie to watch for your health - you may never stop laughing. Starring Michael McKean, Sean Young, Héctor Elizondo, and Harry Dean Stanton, this film was released on the 16th of July 1982 and received an average rating of 5.2. With a whopping budget of 283.9 million dollars, "Young Doctors in Love" delivers a prescription for laughter that is sure to leave audiences in stitches. The tagline for the movie is "Warning: This Movie May Be Dangerous To Your Health. You May Never Stop Laughing."

With a whopping budget of 283.9 million dollars, "Young Doctors in Love" delivers a prescription for laughter that is sure to leave audiences in stitches. title = Intersection 
overview = During a car accident, Vincent Eastman watches his whole life flash before his eyes, and he doesn't like what he sees. While maintaining the semblance of a marriage with his wife, Sally, Vincent has been carrying on with a mistress, Olivia. She's everything Sally isn't -- warm, passionate, carefree. So why can't he choose between the two, especially when his indecision is taking its toll on his daughter? 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Mark Rydell 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the American drama film "Intersection," directed by Mark Rydell, we follow the story of Vincent Eastman as he faces a life-altering car accident. As Vincent's life flashes before his eyes, he is forced to confront the stark reality of his choices. Caught between his wife Sally and his passionate mistress Olivia, Vincent struggles to make a decision that not only affects his own happiness but also the well-being of his daughter. Set against the backdrop of a crumbling marriage and a forbidden affair, "Intersection" explores the complexities of love, loyalty, and self-discovery.

The film was produced in the United States of America and is spoken in English.

title = Sergeant York 
overview = Alvin York a hillbilly sharpshooter transforms himself from ruffian to religious pacifist. He is then called to serve his country and despite deep religious and moral objections to fighting becomes one of the most celebrated American heroes of WWI. 
budget = 1.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Missiles! Jets! Tanks! ...It's Still The Guy With Guts And A Gun Who Wins The War! 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 16.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 1.4 millions of dollars 

In "Sergeant York," Alvin York, a hillbilly sharpshooter, undergoes a remarkable transformation from a ruffian to a religious pacifist. Despite his deep religious and moral objections to fighting, he is called to serve his country during WWI. Through his incredible bravery and marksmanship, he becomes one of the most celebrated American heroes of the war. Produced by Warner Bros. and with a budget of 1.4 million dollars, this English-language film went on to earn an impressive revenue of 16.4 million dollars. As the tagline suggests, amidst missiles, jets, and tanks, it's ultimately the guy with guts and a gun who emerges victorious in the end.

title = Light the Fuse... Sartana Is Coming 
overview = Wily roving gunslinger Sartana arrives in a small town and tries to find a hidden fortune of half a million dollars in gold and two million dollars in counterfeit money. Naturally, a bunch of other treacherous folks who include conniving widow Senora Manassas, shrewd fellow gunslinger Grand Full, and the vicious and unhinged General Monk are also looking to get their greedy hands on said fortune. 
revenue = 294.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
Producer = Luciano Martino 
tagline = Cloud of Dust... Cry of Death... Sartana Is Coming 
date of release = the 24 of December 1970 
Director = Giuliano Carnimeo 
original language of the movie = Italian 
production countrie = Italy 
budget = 147.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.5 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 294.9 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed Western film "Light the Fuse... Sartana Is Coming," the wily gunslinger Sartana rides into a small town on a mission to uncover a hidden fortune of half a million dollars in gold and two million dollars in counterfeit money. As Sartana navigates through treacherous obstacles, including the conniving widow Senora Manassas, shrewd gunslinger Grand Full, and the unhinged General Monk, tensions rise and bullets fly in a deadly game of greed and deception. Directed by Giuliano Carnimeo and produced by Luciano Martino, this Italian production takes viewers on a thrilling ride filled with twists and turns. With a tagline that promises a "Cloud of Dust... Cry of Death... Sartana Is Coming," this film, released on the 24th of December 1970, captivated audiences and raked in a revenue of 294.9 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 147.6 million dollars. The average note of 6.5 reflects the film's ability to keep viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 39-minute duration. The original language of the movie is Italian, and it was produced in Italy.

Sartana Is Coming," this film, released on the 24th of December 1970, captivated audiences and raked in a revenue of 294.9 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 147.6 million dollars. The average note of 6.5 reflects the film's ability to keep viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 39-minute duration. The original language of the movie is Italian, and it was produced in Italy.

title = Burke & Hare 
overview = Two 19th-century opportunists (Simon Pegg, Andy Serkis) become serial killers so that they can maintain their profitable business supplying cadavers to an anatomist (Tom Wilkinson). 
average note = 6.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.1 

In "Burke & Hare," set in the 19th century, two opportunists played by Simon Pegg and Andy Serkis take a dark turn as they venture into the world of serial killing to sustain their lucrative business of providing cadavers to an anatomist portrayed by Tom Wilkinson. As their sinister deeds unfold, the line between greed and morality blurs, leading to a gripping tale of crime and desperation. With an average rating of 6.1, this historical thriller delves into the macabre world of grave robbing and murder, showcasing the lengths some would go to for wealth and success.

title = Wide Awake 
overview = A feel-good comedy about the laughter, excitement and fun that come with being a kid! Joshua is a thoughtful 10-year-old looking for some simple answers to life's eternal questions. The problem is that no one - including his concerned parents and his 5th grade teacher - seems to be making any sense! 
original language of the movie = English

['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the heartwarming comedy "Wide Awake," viewers are taken on a nostalgic journey back to the carefree days of childhood. Follow Joshua, a wise-beyond-his-years 10-year-old, as he navigates the complexities of life's big questions with a mix of humor and curiosity. Set in an English-speaking environment, Joshua's quest for understanding is met with confusion from the adults in his life, including his well-meaning parents and baffled 5th grade teacher. As Joshua seeks clarity in a world full of chaos, audiences are reminded of the joy and innocence that comes with embracing the wonder of youth. The original language of the movie is English. title = Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn 
overview = The adventure unfolds as Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn - Tom's friend from the streets - witness a murder in the graveyard. Tom and Huck flee to Jackson Island and make a pact never to tell anyone about the incident. However, when the good-natured Muff Potter, who has been blamed for the murder is sentenced to death by hanging, Tom breaks his promise and returns to exonerate Muff Potter. In jun Joe, the actual murderer, makes a hasty exit from the courtroom during the trial. A short time later, Tom and Huck find references to a treasure and have to face In jun Joe again. 
production compagnie = cine-partners 
revenue = 257.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 23 of October 2014 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
cast = Val Kilmer, Katherine McNamara, Jake T. Austin, Joel Courtney 
tagline = Everything is about to change. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Jo Kastner 
budget = 29.1 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = cine-partners 

In the thrilling movie "Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn," produced by cine-partners and released on the 23rd of October 2014, viewers are taken on an unforgettable adventure with Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn. The story kicks off when the two friends witness a murder in a graveyard and make a pact to keep it a secret. However, when an innocent man is wrongly accused and sentenced to death, Tom decides to break his promise and sets out to clear the man's name. As they delve deeper into the mystery, Tom and Huck stumble upon clues to a hidden treasure, leading them to confront the real culprit, In jun Joe. Starring Val Kilmer, Katherine McNamara, Jake T. Austin, and Joel Courtney, this 1 hour and 30 minutes film, with a budget of 29.1 million dollars, grossed an impressive 257.8 million dollars at the box office. With the tagline "Everything is about to change," this English-language production from the United States of America, produced by Jo Kastner, promises an exciting and suspenseful cinematic experience. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 257.8 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling movie "Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn," produced by cine-partners and released on the 23rd of October 2014, viewers are taken on an unforgettable adventure with Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn. The story kicks off when the two friends witness a murder in a graveyard and make a pact to keep it a secret. However, when an innocent man is wrongly accused and sentenced to death, Tom decides to break his promise and sets out to clear the man's name. As they delve deeper into the mystery, Tom and Huck stumble upon clues to a hidden treasure, leading them to confront the real culprit, In jun Joe. Starring Val Kilmer, Katherine McNamara, Jake T. Austin, and Joel Courtney, this 1 hour and 30 minutes film, with a budget of 29.1 million dollars, grossed an impressive 257.8 million dollars at the box office. With the tagline "Everything is about to change," this English-language production from the United States of America, produced by Jo Kastner, promises an exciting and suspenseful cinematic experience.

title = Death Weekend 
overview = Harry is a rich dentist who often brings women up to his rural lakehouse. One weekend, he invites Diane, a former fashion model. On their way to the house, Diane runs a gang of thugs off the road. Humiliated, the thugs track down the couple for revenge. 
cast = Brenda Vaccaro, Don Stroud, Chuck Shamata, Richard Ayres 
production countrie = Canada 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Brenda Vaccaro, Don Stroud, Chuck Shamata, Richard Ayres 

In the Canadian thriller "Death Weekend," wealthy dentist Harry regularly retreats to his secluded lakehouse with different women. When he invites former fashion model Diane for a weekend getaway, their trip takes a terrifying turn. After a confrontation on the road with a gang of thugs, the couple finds themselves hunted down for revenge. Starring Brenda Vaccaro, Don Stroud, Chuck Shamata, and Richard Ayres, this intense film showcases a deadly game of cat and mouse in the picturesque Canadian wilderness. The production country for "Death Weekend" is Canada.

In the thrilling movie "Highway to Hell," Charlie and Rachel make a daring escape from home to elope in Las Vegas, only to have their plans disrupted by a zombie attack. The terrifying undead creature kidnaps Rachel and drags her down to hell, where she faces the chilling fate of becoming one of Satan's brides. Directed by Ate de Jong and featuring a talented cast including Patrick Bergin, Adam Storke, Chad Lowe, and Kristy Swanson, this English-language film was released on the 21st of November 1991. With a budget of 9.0 million dollars, "Highway to Hell" unfortunately did not see significant financial success, earning 0.0 million dollars at the box office. title = Kick-Ass 2 
overview = After Kick-Ass’ insane bravery inspires a new wave of self-made masked crusaders, he joins a patrol led by the Colonel Stars and Stripes. When these amateur superheroes are hunted down by Red Mist — reborn as The Mother Fucker — only the blade-wielding Hit-Girl can prevent their annihilation. 
tagline = You Can't Fight Your Destiny. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Jeff Wadlow 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 28.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
cast = Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloë Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, Clark Duke 
date of release = the 17 of July 2013 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = You Can't Fight Your Destiny. 

In "Kick-Ass 2," directed by Jeff Wadlow, the story continues as Kick-Ass, played by Aaron Taylor-Johnson, inspires a new wave of self-made masked crusaders. Teaming up with Colonel Stars and Stripes, they form a patrol to fight crime. However, their amateur superhero group faces a formidable enemy in the form of Red Mist, now known as The Mother Fucker, portrayed by Christopher Mintz-Plasse. Only Hit-Girl, played by Chloë Grace Moretz, with her blade-wielding skills, can save them from annihilation. As they battle destiny and face their toughest challenge yet, the tagline "You Can't Fight Your Destiny" rings true. This action-packed movie, released on July 17, 2013, in the United States, has an average rating of 6.3. With a budget of 28.0 million dollars, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 43 minutes, also starring Clark Duke.

title = Shine a Light 
overview = Martin Scorsese and the Rolling Stones unite in "Shine A Light," a look at The Rolling Stones." Scorsese filmed the Stones over a two-day period at the intimate Beacon Theater in New York City in fall 2006. Cinematographers capture the raw energy of the legendary band. 
revenue = 272.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 272.6 millions of dollars 

In "Shine a Light," legendary director Martin Scorsese collaborates with iconic rock band The Rolling Stones to deliver an electrifying cinematic experience. Filmed over two days at the intimate Beacon Theater in New York City in fall 2006, this documentary captures the raw energy and magnetic stage presence of the Stones like never before. With cinematography that immerses the audience in the heart of the concert, viewers are treated to a front-row seat to witness the magic of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, and the rest of the band. "Shine a Light" not only showcases the enduring talent of The Rolling Stones but also serves as a testament to their unparalleled influence on the music industry. With a staggering revenue of 272.6 million dollars, this film solidifies its status as a must-see for music lovers and cinephiles alike. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 7.2 

In "Shine a Light," legendary director Martin Scorsese collaborates with iconic rock band The Rolling Stones to deliver an electrifying cinematic experience. Filmed over two days at the intimate Beacon Theater in New York City in fall 2006, this documentary captures the raw energy and magnetic stage presence of the Stones like never before. With cinematography that immerses the audience in the heart of the concert, viewers are treated to a front-row seat to witness the magic of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, and the rest of the band. "Shine a Light" not only showcases the enduring talent of The Rolling Stones but also serves as a testament to their unparalleled influence on the music industry. With a staggering revenue of 272.6 million dollars, this film solidifies its status as a must-see for music lovers and cinephiles alike. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h02 

In "Shine a Light," legendary director Martin Scorsese collaborates with iconic rock band The Rolling Stones to deliver an electrifying cinematic experience. Filmed over two days at the intimate Beacon Theater in New York City in fall 2006, this documentary captures the raw energy and magnetic stage presence of the Stones like never before. With cinematography that immerses the audience in the heart of the concert, viewers are treated to a front-row seat to witness the magic of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, and the rest of the band. "Shine a Light" not only showcases the enduring talent of The Rolling Stones but also serves as a testament to their unparalleled influence on the music industry. With a staggering revenue of 272.6 million dollars, this film solidifies its status as a must-see for music lovers and cinephiles alike.

title = The Hideous Sun Demon 
overview = After exposure to radiation, an atomic research scientist finds himself changing into a murderous, lizard-like creature every time he is exposed to sunlight. 
tagline = The Blaze Of The Sun Made Him A Monster! 
date of release = the 28 of August 1958 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 262.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Robert Clarke 
Producer = Robert Clarke 
average note = 5.7 
budget = 212.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Robert Clarke, Patricia Manning, Nan Peterson, Patrick Whyte 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The Blaze Of The Sun Made Him A Monster! 

In the 1958 American film "The Hideous Sun Demon," directed and produced by Robert Clarke, an atomic research scientist undergoes a terrifying transformation into a murderous, lizard-like creature whenever he is exposed to sunlight. The tagline "The Blaze Of The Sun Made Him A Monster!" captures the essence of this sci-fi horror movie. Starring Robert Clarke, Patricia Manning, Nan Peterson, and Patrick Whyte, the film explores the consequences of radiation exposure. Despite its budget of 212.8 million dollars, the movie managed to generate an impressive revenue of 262.0 million dollars. With an average rating of 5.7, this English-language production remains a classic in the realm of creature features. The movie was released on the 28th of August 1958 in the United States of America.

['correct']

With an average rating of 5.7, this English-language production remains a classic in the realm of creature features. The movie was released on the 28th of August 1958 in the United States of America.

title = Darkman III: Die Darkman Die 
overview = Darkman, needing money to continue his experiments on synthetic skin, steals a crate of cash from drug lord Peter Rooker... 
production compagnie = Renaissance Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Renaissance Pictures 

In "Darkman III: Die Darkman Die," produced by Renaissance Pictures, we follow the story of Darkman who is in desperate need of money to fund his experiments on synthetic skin. To achieve this, he decides to steal a crate of cash from the dangerous drug lord Peter Rooker. As Darkman delves deeper into the criminal underworld, he must navigate treacherous waters to survive and achieve his goals. Will his quest for funds lead to his ultimate downfall, or will he emerge victorious in the end?

title = Return of Sabata 
overview = Master gunslinger Sabata arrives in Hobsonville, a town completely owned by McIntock, a robber baron who is taxing the inhabitants for the cost of future improvements to the town. Or that's what McIntock says he'll do with the money... 
tagline = The man with gunsight eyes is back! 
revenue = 31.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Lee Van Cleef, Reiner Schöne, Giampiero Albertini, Ignazio Spalla 
production compagnie = Les Productions Artistes Associés 
Producer = Alberto Grimaldi 
Director = Gianfranco Parolini 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The man with gunsight eyes is back! 

In "Return of Sabata," the master gunslinger Sabata rides into the town of Hobsonville, where the ruthless robber baron McIntock controls everything. McIntock is extorting money from the townspeople under the guise of funding future town improvements. Or that's what McIntock says he'll do with the money... As Sabata navigates the treacherous landscape of corruption and greed, he must use his sharpshooting skills to take down McIntock and restore justice to the town. Starring Lee Van Cleef as Sabata, alongside Reiner Schöne, Giampiero Albertini, and Ignazio Spalla, this action-packed Western is a thrilling tale of vengeance and redemption. Directed by Gianfranco Parolini and produced by Alberto Grimaldi for Les Productions Artistes Associés, "Return of Sabata" grossed an impressive $31.4 million at the box office. With the tagline "The man with gunsight eyes is back," this film is a must-watch for fans of classic Westerns. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 31.4 millions of dollars

Directed by Gianfranco Parolini and produced by Alberto Grimaldi for Les Productions Artistes Associés, "Return of Sabata" grossed an impressive $31.4 million at the box office. With the tagline "The man with gunsight eyes is back," this film is a must-watch for fans of classic Westerns.

title = Men of Honor 
overview = Against formidable odds -- and an old-school diving instructor embittered by the U.S. Navy's new, less prejudicial policies -- Carl Brashear sets his sights on becoming the Navy's first African-American master diver in this uplifting true story. Their relationship starts out on the rocks, but fate ultimately conspires to bring the men together into a setting of mutual respect, triumph and honor. 
date of release = the 13 of September 2000 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 48.8 millions of dollars 
budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 13 of September 2000 

In the inspiring true story "Men of Honor," released on the 13th of September 2000, Carl Brashear faces daunting challenges as he strives to become the U.S. Navy's first African-American master diver. Despite facing prejudice from his old-school diving instructor, Brashear's determination and resilience shine through. As their relationship evolves from rocky beginnings to one of mutual respect, the film showcases themes of triumph and honor. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, "Men of Honor" went on to earn an impressive revenue of 48.8 million dollars, proving the enduring appeal of this tale of perseverance and achievement. The movie is in English, the original language.

title = Ilsa, the Mad Butcher 
overview = Ilsa, now a vicious warden, runs a mental-hospital for young women. 
production countrie = Switzerland 
cast = Dyanne Thorne, Tania Busselier, Eric Falk, Lina Romay 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
tagline = Once commited to her care, You'll be too terrified to die!.. You'll choke with fear!.. Recoil in horror from her unleashed fury!.. 
Producer = Erwin C. Dietrich 
budget = 272.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of January 1977 
original language of the movie = German 
production compagnie = Elite Film 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Switzerland 

In the chilling movie "Ilsa, the Mad Butcher," the infamous Ilsa takes on a new role as a ruthless warden at a mental hospital for young women. Set in Switzerland, this German-language film produced by Elite Film and released on January 21, 1977, delves into the horrors that unfold under Ilsa's tyrannical rule. Starring Dyanne Thorne, Tania Busselier, Eric Falk, and Lina Romay, the movie runs for 1 hour and 30 minutes, showcasing the twisted power dynamics within the institution. With a staggering budget of 272.0 million dollars, this production by Erwin C. Dietrich promises to shock and terrify audiences with its tagline: "Once committed to her care, You'll be too terrified to die!.. You'll choke with fear!.. Recoil in horror from her unleashed fury!.."

The production company behind this intense film is Elite Film.

title = Blood of Ghastly Horror 
overview = A mad scientist implants an electronic device into the brain of an injured soldier, which turns him into a psychotic killer. 
Producer = Al Adamson 
cast = John Carradine, Kent Taylor, Tommy Kirk, Regina Carrol 
tagline = Human zombies rise from their coffins as living corpses! 
production compagnie = Independent International Pictures (I-I) 
date of release = the 21 of January 1972 
average note = 1.5 
revenue = 288.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Al Adamson 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 10.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Al Adamson 

In "Blood of Ghastly Horror," produced by Al Adamson under Independent International Pictures (I-I), a mad scientist performs a chilling experiment by implanting an electronic device into the brain of an injured soldier. This twisted act transforms the soldier into a psychotic killer, setting off a chain of events that lead to human zombies rising from their coffins as living corpses. Directed by Al Adamson and released on the 21st of January 1972 in the United States of America, this horror film features a stellar cast including John Carradine, Kent Taylor, Tommy Kirk, and Regina Carrol. With a budget of 10.1 million dollars, the movie went on to gross an impressive 288.3 million dollars at the box office, despite receiving an average rating of 1.5. The dialogue and terror unfold in the original English language, captivating audiences with its spine-chilling tale of science gone horribly wrong. The tagline for the movie is "Human zombies rise from their coffins as living corpses!"

With a budget of 10.1 million dollars, the movie went on to gross an impressive 288.3 million dollars at the box office, despite receiving an average rating of 1.5. The dialogue and terror unfold in the original English language, captivating audiences with its spine-chilling tale of science gone horribly wrong. The tagline for the movie is "Human zombies rise from their coffins as living corpses!"

title = Scream Blacula Scream 
overview = After a dying Voodoo queen chooses an adopted apprentice as her successor, her true heir is outraged. Seeking revenge, he buys the bones of Blacula the vampire off of a dealer, and uses voodoo to bring the vampire back to do his bidding. In turn, Blacula turns him into a vampire and makes him his slave. Meanwhile, a police officer with a large collection of African antiques and an interest in the occult investigates the murders caused by Blacula and his vampire horde. 
tagline = The black prince of shadows stalks the earth again! 
production compagnie = American International Pictures (AIP) 
Producer = Joseph T. Naar 
date of release = the 27 of June 1973 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The black prince of shadows stalks the earth again! 

In the 1973 horror film "Scream Blacula Scream," the legacy of a dying Voodoo queen takes a dark turn when her chosen successor is usurped by her true heir, who resurrects the infamous vampire, Blacula, through voodoo magic. Blacula, in turn, transforms his betrayer into a vampire slave. As a police officer delves into the mysterious murders linked to Blacula and his undead minions, a chilling tale of revenge and the supernatural unfolds. Produced by Joseph T. Naar and released on June 27, 1973, this American International Pictures (AIP) production brings to life the tagline: "The black prince of shadows stalks the earth again!"

title = Nailbiter 
overview = A horror film that combines classic monster movie elements set within the backdrop of unpredictable Kansas weather. Start with a mother and her three daughters forced to take shelter from an advancing tornado in a local storm cellar. What is waiting for them underneath is another story entirely. 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 57.1 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Patrick Rea 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the heart-pounding horror film "Nailbiter," director Patrick Rea takes audiences on a terrifying journey into the unpredictable Kansas weather. When a mother and her three daughters seek refuge from an approaching tornado in a local storm cellar, they unknowingly stumble upon a chilling secret lurking beneath the ground. Combining classic monster movie elements with a suspenseful narrative, this American production, with a budget of 57.1 million dollars, unfolds in English, the original language of the movie. Brace yourself for a nail-biting experience as the characters face the ultimate test of survival in the face of unimaginable horrors. The movie was produced in the United States of America.

title = Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde 
overview = After Elle Woods, the eternally perky, fashionably adventurous, famously blonde Harvard Law grad gets fired by her law firm because of her opposition to animal testing, she takes her fight to Washington. As an aide for Congresswoman Victoria Rudd, she pushes for a bill to ban testing once and for all, but it's her building's doorman who advises her on how to get her way on the Hill. 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
date of release = the 2 of July 2003 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h35 

In "Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde," Elle Woods, the iconic Harvard Law graduate known for her bubbly personality and impeccable fashion sense, finds herself on a mission in Washington D.C. After being fired from her law firm due to her strong stance against animal testing, Elle joins forces with Congresswoman Victoria Rudd to advocate for a bill that would outlaw such practices. Along the way, she receives unexpected guidance from her building's doorman, who helps her navigate the complexities of Capitol Hill. Released on the 2nd of July 2003, this empowering and comedic sequel runs for a duration of 1 hour and 35 minutes.

In "Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde," Elle Woods, the iconic Harvard Law graduate known for her bubbly personality and impeccable fashion sense, finds herself on a mission in Washington D.C. After being fired from her law firm due to her strong stance against animal testing, Elle joins forces with Congresswoman Victoria Rudd to advocate for a bill that would outlaw such practices. Along the way, she receives unexpected guidance from her building's doorman, who helps her navigate the complexities of Capitol Hill. Released on the 2nd of July 2003, this empowering and comedic sequel runs for a duration of 1 hour and 35 minutes.
